about: F5SXMT offers Muay Thai, kettlebells, barbell, and bodyweight training.
text: This is as good as it gets, seriously.  Training with Roxy is fun, exhausting, empowering, invigorating, and I could keep going.  Each session brings something new, challenging and exciting.  I have been training with Roxy for a little over three years and she has helped me to transform.  I started out of shape, insecure, and unhappy with my body.  Now I walk around strong, confident, energized, fit and lean!

about: F5SXMT offers Muay Thai, kettlebells, barbell, and bodyweight training.
text: I started training with Roxy because I was looking to train with a group of women in Thai Boxing who were serious about their training and not just looking to hook up with guys at the gym.  After seeing Roxy fight and reading her training blog, I had a great deal of respect for her and her training ethic. Definitely worth the almost hour long drive it usually takes me to get to the facility on Monday and Wednesday mornings.  The workouts are intense and I leave the studio feeling amazing.  The other women are great to train with and have a drive and passion for their training that I really admire.  A lot of pad work, some sparring when you're ready for it, and some ab/core work usually round out the daily workouts.  Unfortunately, I'm sidelined right now with a shoulder injury (unrelated), but you can bet I'll be back making the hour long drive as soon as I'm able to!

about: F5SXMT offers Muay Thai, kettlebells, barbell, and bodyweight training.
text: I hate to admit it, but I haven't been to a gym in years! I finally decided to get off my butt and work out again, but didn't want to go to one of the large, impersonal gyms I went to before. Enter Function 5 Fitness and Muay Thai. The gym is small, the classes are small - which is a good thing. You don't feel like a number here. This is definitely where the "cool kids" hang out. Lots of rock hard bodies with tattoos, dressed in black. Heck, the owner, Roxy, is a professional fighter so of course she's gonna be a bad ass! Other professional fighters train here, too. If that intimidates you, then don't come here. The classes are filled with a mix of people, but most are young and fit. If that bothers you, then don't come here. That said, the vibe is supportive. I feel like the biggest (and oldest) dork in the room. There's no way I make Muay Thai look cool. I still haven't gotten the moves right and I'm usually huffing and puffing with a bright red face. But, I like the workouts. I like punching and kicking - I NEED punching and kicking in my life. The instruction is top notch - emphasis on proper form with a non-judgmental attitude. If you're looking for a "no nonsense" gym with small classes, quality instruction, and killer workouts, then this is the place for you!

about: F5SXMT offers Muay Thai, kettlebells, barbell, and bodyweight training.
text: This place has literally transformed my life!  Went in with a goal to get healthy and active- I was extremely sedentary and needed a kick in the pants to get going.  From my first meeting with Daniel, I was completely hooked.  And the results have been extraordinary- in three months I've lost weight and gotten stronger than I've ever been in my life.  The classes are super fun and informative- you're learning a sport and the teachers are very serious about what they do.  I can't say enough good things about the team over there- Daniel and Kate, in particular have been incredible cheerleaders and I've become addicted to their classes.

about: F5SXMT offers Muay Thai, kettlebells, barbell, and bodyweight training.
text: All the instructors here are very friendly and encouraging.  It's a great place for beginners to learn Muay Thai.  I haven't tried any of the other classes out yet, but I'm sure they're great, because of the friendly staff and their willingness to work with any skill level.

about: F5SXMT offers Muay Thai, kettlebells, barbell, and bodyweight training.
text: I didn't realize this but apparently I've started writing this review multiple times. I remain super impressed with what I've experienced at Function Five Fitness. In fact, I go as far to say as, this gym has literally changed my life. I know it may sound corny but its true.

about: F5SXMT offers Muay Thai, kettlebells, barbell, and bodyweight training.
text: So being new to LA and feeling adventurous, I wanted to try kickboxing. The first step for me was to yelp kickboxing near my area and this place showed up. I was overwhelmed by how may reviews it had compared to the other places plus they were all rated 5 stars. After attending even one class I see why!

about: F5SXMT offers Muay Thai, kettlebells, barbell, and bodyweight training.
text: So I was in LA for a 3 month contract and needed some exercise. Roxy and the crew are fantastic, but as anyone who has been around a good Muay Thai gym knows it's about the community and the other members. I felt welcome from day one, even though I was a total beginner. Finally a Muay Thai gym that plays rock music instead of techno, kicks my ass without making me feel like a wimp and has the community. Too bad it's in LA and I live in SF.

about: F5SXMT offers Muay Thai, kettlebells, barbell, and bodyweight training.
text: Hands down the most liberating, stress releasing, body trimming, mind focusing work out you can possibly find.  The entire team at Function Five help you accomplish goals (both personal & physical) you never dreamed of achieving.  There's absolutely nothing like Muay Thai before a day of work or to wind down from a crazy day. The classes are full of supportive teammates, who not only challenging you but cheer you on at the same time.  I have been with Roxy for nearly 2 years and I never plan on leaving.

about: F5SXMT offers Muay Thai, kettlebells, barbell, and bodyweight training.
text: This gym is awesome. The instructors are way more knowledgeable, focused on form and on its clients specific needs/limitations/abilties than I've experienced with any of the "posh", more expensive gyms and trainers I've used. It's also got a great community feel. I've been doing a mix of Muay Thai and traditional training - and both are great. MT is one of the most fun workouts I've ever done. Overall - highly recommend.

about: F5SXMT offers Muay Thai, kettlebells, barbell, and bodyweight training.
text: Roxy is amazing.

about: F5SXMT offers Muay Thai, kettlebells, barbell, and bodyweight training.
text: Oh hey y'all.  The other reviewers aren't lying when they say that the Function 5 Fitness team and Roxy are amazzzzzing.  I found the gym while searching for kickboxing in LA, but it's so much more than that.  Roxy offers personal training, nutrition advice, and a super positive, fun environment that really makes you want to come back and work out.  She's also a great source for all things LA - quality recommendations for everything from chiropractors to hair salons.  Plus, you can't help but love her for the fact that she seems to knows how to push you w/out you really realizing that she's pushing you.  She's definitely figured out how to create a positive atmosphere without turning it into a preschool/coddling type of environment.  And, they just got a gym cat who is absolutely adorable.  What more could you want from a place?

about: F5SXMT offers Muay Thai, kettlebells, barbell, and bodyweight training.
text: Being newish to LA I had been searching for a new Muay Thai gym. In all my research I kept coming back and checking out the F5 website. The price seemed right and the environment they projected looked really positive and inviting. Yesterday they were running a special deal on Yelp and I jumped on it. Natalie had the unfortunate task of helping me when I called. She helped me figure out what level class to jump into and also answered several other questions and helped me get into my first class there. A class that was already full, that I was trying to get into last minute, and at a sale price - she still did everything she could to help me while being incredibly sweet. I was half expecting a full blindside leg kick as I walked in the door (it would have been well deserved). Instead, I was greeted with a smile AND they let me borrow hand wraps (I forgot mine in my rush to make it to class). From there I started into the class that was being taught by Kate. She gave me some great instruction and ran a fun class that was a great workout. As we moved into the padwork, my eyes lit up. THEY HAVE FRESH GEAR! I grabbed the pads and to my surprise they still had cushion. If you've never worked pads, trust me this is huge. Most gyms live on their craptastic gear for ages.

about: F5SXMT offers Muay Thai, kettlebells, barbell, and bodyweight training.
text: I went to a free intro Muy Thai class with a friend to check it out and I had a great time. Roxy and the other instructor were great. I then took the MMA Circuits and Drills class with Dustin. He's also great. To be honest, exercising at the gym has always been BORING to me and jogging is also dull. I guess I have a short attention span. Roxy, Dustin an d the rest know what they are doing and they will keep your mind and body engaged. I'm glad I found out about this place. I

about: F5SXMT offers Muay Thai, kettlebells, barbell, and bodyweight training.
text: Roxy changed my life. I have been seeing her for about 3-4 months now, and my body, lifestyle, mental and physical health have done a complete 180. I have never been in better shape in my life. She's not only my personal trainer, but nutritionist and Muay Thai guru-- and I have never loved working out the way that I do now. I take Muay Thai classes about 5 times a week, with a strength conditioning training session thrown in there and I'd take more classes if I could-- it is so rewarding!!! Literally, I am a new person, and I have her specifically to thank :)

about: F5SXMT offers Muay Thai, kettlebells, barbell, and bodyweight training.
text: I started training with Roxy in January. Incorporating Muay Thai into my fitness regimen has changed my life!! Training with Roxy, I've developed a new level of physical strength that I have never experienced before. We've become great friends in the meantime. As a fellow trainer, she is totally my hero!!! I look up to and respect her, and aspire to be as powerful as she is in my training. She will uproot a dormant element of physical possibility that you may not realize you are capable of. Roxy, thank you for my deltoids!!

about: F5SXMT offers Muay Thai, kettlebells, barbell, and bodyweight training.
text: I've had a couple of Muay Thai Kick- sessions with Roxy and am certainly a big fan.

about: F5SXMT offers Muay Thai, kettlebells, barbell, and bodyweight training.
text: I started training with Roxy back in 2007. I'm in and out of town all the time for work. The first thing I do when I get back in town is give her a call. I'm really excited that she has her own place now. I used to just train Muay Thai with her but now she has a full gym at her disposal. She definitely works me out hard! But it is always exciting, new and challenging. Roxy is great at what she does; always smiling, always giving me new challenges and always encouraging. And..she's getting me in great shape. Love her!

about: F5SXMT offers Muay Thai, kettlebells, barbell, and bodyweight training.
text: great friendly gym, super nice people, and really reasonably priced, will definitely be back for some more training.

about: F5SXMT offers Muay Thai, kettlebells, barbell, and bodyweight training.
text: I started training Muay Thai at Function Five about 2 months ago. It has been a painful journey for the ego, and the body, but it is absolutely amazing learning and living. Thanks to all the instructors that I have had. Everyone is intent on technique and they are relentless in pushing you to do it correctly. The pairing can be challenging on any given day, but they do a terrific job in matching people, and quite frankly, catering the classes to the strengths and weaknesses of the pairings. I am sort of looking forward to getting hit in the head, but so far all the bumps and bruises have  been self inflicted. It is a bummer when I have the pad close to my face and forget to offer resistance, but it gets me back in the moment really quickly! Thanks F5!

about: F5SXMT offers Muay Thai, kettlebells, barbell, and bodyweight training.
text: I have to move across the country for work, and one of the things I will miss the most about Los Angeles is Function 5 Fitness. In my six months at Function 5, I considerably lowered my cholesterol and blood pressure, significantly reduced the medication I have to take, drastically lowered my alcohol intake (and other bad habits that need not be enumerated on Yelp), lost about 20 pounds of fat, and gained strength. I was able to recoup the vast amount of  membership costs in saved health care expenses, and projecting out into the future, I am  confident in saying that my time at Function 5 will end up saving me a good deal of money.  Everyone I worked with at Function 5 (and I worked with all the Muay Thai instructors, Roxy, Kate, Emily, Dustin, Daniel, and Anthony) are excellent, and more importantly, they are kind and genuine people, which is tough to find in this town. Function 5 helped me make considerable lifestyle changes, and Muay Thai is a tremendous amount of fun. If you live close enough to join this gym, consider yourself extremely lucky.

about: F5SXMT offers Muay Thai, kettlebells, barbell, and bodyweight training.
text: First place I went to try out since I got a deal on trubutes.. The parking is a hassel but the classes are great.. I will b a reg here. Great way to work out bc i hate the gym and here I don't even complain about working out at all...Instructors are awesome, patient, and very good at teaching. Prices are very convient as well...

about: F5SXMT offers Muay Thai, kettlebells, barbell, and bodyweight training.
text: I honestly can say that I wish I could train with Roxy every single day.  She has been so great at motivating me and pushing me to do things that I didn't think were possible.  In addition to being a trainer, she is also a nutritionist and her knowledge and awareness of the mind/body connection is a great resource.  I definitely need a trainer who can be patient and kind and Roxy is both of those things, but she definitely makes you WORK!!  Encouragement is key in making real life changes and Roxy is there with you every step of the way to cheer you on and make sure that you are able to reach your fitness goals.  In addition to all of the hard work and support, our workouts are NEVER boring.  Roxy prepares an individual workout for each client, each visit.  So, you never do the same routine twice.  There isn't anything else that I could ask for in a personal trainer.  I heart Roxyfit!!!!!

about: F5SXMT offers Muay Thai, kettlebells, barbell, and bodyweight training.
text: Function 5 is hands down the best Muay Thai gym in Los Angeles. The classes are small, the instructors are knowledgeable, professional, and most of all... Friendly. I've been to 3-4 Muay Thai and MMA gyms in LA, and buff dudes with egos are a dime a dozen. You won't find any of that at F5.

about: F5SXMT offers Muay Thai, kettlebells, barbell, and bodyweight training.
text: I was terrified of going to take Muay Thai because aside from dancing, I've never been athletic at all. Miserably failed as a child when I tried swimming, karate, and basketball. But here I am, 21 trying to get fit and deal with the stress of young adulthood.

about: F5SXMT offers Muay Thai, kettlebells, barbell, and bodyweight training.
text: I LOVE this place!  I think it may be the best thing I have ever done in my life.  My friends can tell you how much I hate to work out, but this has changed my entire attitude towards sweating!  It is the only thing that has gotten me off my couch and improved my health.

about: F5SXMT offers Muay Thai, kettlebells, barbell, and bodyweight training.
text: Absolutely the  most informative classes (Recovery & Mobility, and Intro to Kettlebells) I've ever attended. At any price. The Yelp discount? Sheer Gravy.

about: F5SXMT offers Muay Thai, kettlebells, barbell, and bodyweight training.
text: I have been at this gym for about a year now. It's small, it's friendly. The staff cares, and the community is super supportive. I love it.

about: F5SXMT offers Muay Thai, kettlebells, barbell, and bodyweight training.
text: Yeah I know it seems weird this place has only 5 star reviews - but it's that great of a gym!

about: F5SXMT offers Muay Thai, kettlebells, barbell, and bodyweight training.
text: I began training at F5F six months ago and it's been a wonderful, transformative experience.  I've been generally athletic my entire life but had fallen out of any consistent regiment and was in pretty marginal shape.  I was getting fat, my flexibility and stamina were poor, and I'd gotten pretty weak.  I wasn't eating right and work related stress was getting the best of me.  As a result, I began to experience a variety of small but noticeable health concerns including circulation issues, joint pain, bad posture and inconsistent sleep.  One day I just took it all in and it was clear that I needed to make a change.

about: F5SXMT offers Muay Thai, kettlebells, barbell, and bodyweight training.
text: Great place for Muay Thai.  Have only trained with Kate and Emily so far because of my schedule, but have known about Roxy and Dustin for a while and they are all top notch.

about: F5SXMT offers Muay Thai, kettlebells, barbell, and bodyweight training.
text: I love all the bad ass female instructors; they are an inspiration.  A bunch of tough looking dudes came in after one of my beginners' classes, and there was something really empowering about seeing Kate teach it.

about: F5SXMT offers Muay Thai, kettlebells, barbell, and bodyweight training.
text: Great Muay Thai classes! Professional and nice instructors.

about: F5SXMT offers Muay Thai, kettlebells, barbell, and bodyweight training.
text: Its been and year and a half and I am going pretty much everyday for muay thai classes, sometimes 2 on saturdays. I work a full time job and make time for it in the morning (and sometimes night) because without it, my days just don't seem the same! this is when you know you've become and addict. hello, my name is sydel and I love F5. I moved since I started and decided to stay close (I actually moved down the street) because of it and some of my best friends, I met in classes. I normally dislike class type workouts and used to think $40 24 hr fitness membership would cut it, but this has changed my idea of what a workout is (mentally and physically) and the price is 100% worth it. I pretty much see all the trainers every day, if I don't I see them inside the gym I'll probably see them during other fun gym events like bowling, watching live fights, etc. because they're just all around awesome people- but really i'll just see you guys tomorrow morning ;)

about: F5SXMT offers Muay Thai, kettlebells, barbell, and bodyweight training.
text: So at the outset I will say this is a very personal review for me.

about: F5SXMT offers Muay Thai, kettlebells, barbell, and bodyweight training.
text: AMAZING!!!!! all my life I have been trying to get fit and have always been met by a wall that refuses to turn anything on my body into muscle. I have even tried personal trainers! i started taking muay thai 2 and half months ago (3 times a week) and i have never seen such a change in my body like i have recently. The trainers here push you to your limit (without fainting) and provide you with positive feedback and encouragement. This is not your LA fitness cardio kickboxing type of class, be prepared to kick people (holding padding of course hehe) as well as to be kicked but DON"T be scared! it is the best stress relief around =D and your muscles will thank you for it.

about: F5SXMT offers Muay Thai, kettlebells, barbell, and bodyweight training.
text: Today was my last day at F5 because tomorrow I am moving to New York. I've had thirteen great months at the gym, and I can honestly say that besides my friends Function 5 is the thing I am going to miss the most about Los Angeles.

about: F5SXMT offers Muay Thai, kettlebells, barbell, and bodyweight training.
text: It's been almost two months since I've started training at Roxy Fit and I think I'm hooked! I was looking for a martial arts class because i wanted to work out AND learn a skill at the same time: this is perfect.

about: F5SXMT offers Muay Thai, kettlebells, barbell, and bodyweight training.
text: I started here a few months ago coming from a crossfit gym that offered Muay Thai once a day.  I needed a new place with more options because I fell in love with Muay Thai.  I'm so glad I gave Function 5 a try.  Really great instruction, quality teachers, and fun people to work out with make this place a 5 star for sure!  The intro offer makes it worth trying for anyone that doubts.

about: F5SXMT offers Muay Thai, kettlebells, barbell, and bodyweight training.
text: Here's the thing; generally, I'm not a fan of exercise or anything that brings hard work. So basically, I'm the definition of lazy, and I thought that I had accepted that - up 'until the holidays (let's all sigh in agreement). I work full time in an office, and though I grew up dancing religiously, I haven't been to a dance class in a couple years, therefore, my "activeness" was practically zero. Y'know the drill, you wanna make change, blah, blah. The typical gym thing wasn't working out for me - most of the time I scurried away into the sauna and no one could stop me. Eventually, the stress, the frustration of the way I looked and felt was overwhelming. I came across F5, specifically interested in muay thai. I had tried it before, years ago, but at an (unwritten) all-men's sort of place. It was cool, I guess, if I had boy parts, but since I didn't, I was pretty much left in the back to sob alone and was never paid any attention to. After that, I gave up, so when the chance to try it again came up - I was hesitant for something similar to occur.

about: F5SXMT offers Muay Thai, kettlebells, barbell, and bodyweight training.
text: This gym is incredible! All the trainers are really good at what they do and are very dedicated to seeing you succeed with your goals. I loved strength and conditioning with Jess and Tyler - made me stronger and encouraged me to continue lifting and gaining strength. Muay Thai here is great, every trainer makes sure to correct you and help you get the right form. Even though you take classes - you definitely get personal instruction within each class. Best gym in LA!!!! Five stars isn't enough for how great of a gym it is, and everyone here is super friendly - the culture is very welcoming!

about: F5SXMT offers Muay Thai, kettlebells, barbell, and bodyweight training.
text: An Empowering Place to Train

about: F5SXMT offers Muay Thai, kettlebells, barbell, and bodyweight training.
text: There are so many great things to say about Function 5 Fitness and their team of trainers. But first a short background about myself. At one point when i was younger I was very active with sports (basketball). I use to play on a regular basis and eventually when you aren't apart of any leagues or teams it quickly becomes once in a while or hardly ever. Next thing you know its months then years pass since being active. I've done the usual join a gym go for a the first few weeks and eventually stop. Can't stand the gym crowds and not really having enough of a knowledge or initiative to create and stick to a gym regiment.

about:
BOOT CAMP H2O is the first-of a-kind Los Angeles based water fitness program to offer the highest level aquatic training exercise regime.
 
This is a hybrid of strength training and traditional water aerobics classes, H2O offers comprehensive sessions created specifically for each client and designed to strengthen core muscles groups.
 
A combination of traditional water classes and high intensity water based fitness program, provide the benefits of working out in a pool, with little to no impact on joints while expanding lung capacity, as well as the benefits of weight and resistance training of a traditional gym workout.
text: I am hooked! I've been going to Bootcamp H20 consistently for just three months and I can easily say, it's the best and hardest workout I've had in my life. I have always been athletic and looking for challenging workouts, but in the past few years have had some serious back issues. The workouts that Igor leads are super intense, but with little to no impact on your joints (and my back, for that matter). You don't just swim laps, you are in and out of the pool, doing pushups, lunges, squats, and using weights nonstop for an hour. No workout is ever the same. Everyone I've met in the class has been doing this class with Igor for 2-4 years - real dedicated, and most of all strong with crazy endurance. I've gotten a lot stronger in the short time I've been going. You have to be able to swim at least freestyle. We do butterfly stroke a lot also, which I was terrible at, but after class one day recently Igor literally taught me how to do butterfly perfectly in, I kid you not, 20 minutes! Very impressive! I want to also mention that it's all ages, shapes, and sizes. And getting up for a 6 a.m. class seems awful, but you get used to it pretty quick. It's a great way to start the day.

about:

This is a hybrid of strength training and traditional water aerobics classes, H2O offers comprehensive sessions created specifically for each client and designed to strengthen core muscles groups.
 
A combination of traditional water classes and high intensity water based fitness program, provide the benefits of working out in a pool, with little to no impact on joints while expanding lung capacity, as well as the benefits of weight and resistance training of a traditional gym workout.
text: Working out is my favorite thing to do, & this is my favorite workout.

about:

This is a hybrid of strength training and traditional water aerobics classes, H2O offers comprehensive sessions created specifically for each client and designed to strengthen core muscles groups.
 
A combination of traditional water classes and high intensity water based fitness program, provide the benefits of working out in a pool, with little to no impact on joints while expanding lung capacity, as well as the benefits of weight and resistance training of a traditional gym workout.
text: When I first saw this boot camp on Groupon during the Summer, I HAD to get it...I missed the deal. So, when a client mentioned this workout a few months ago, I immediately went to the web-site and signed up.

about:
BOOT CAMP H2O is the first-of a-kind Los Angeles based water fitness program to offer the highest level aquatic training exercise regime.
 
This is a hybrid of strength training and traditional water aerobics classes, H2O offers comprehensive sessions created specifically for each client and designed to strengthen core muscles groups.
 
A combination of traditional water classes and high intensity water based fitness program, provide the benefits of working out in a pool, with little to no impact on joints while expanding lung capacity, as well as the benefits of weight and resistance training of a traditional gym workout.
text: Run by Igor & Dana with both beginner and advanced classes, Boot Camp H2O is not like any workout you've ever done!  They do a good job of varying the workouts from day to day, week to week so your body will always be guessing which is awesome for your workouts!  I'm a beginner through and through so it's been a learning curve for myself which is great as it makes me want to work/try harder to get better at swimming.  Igor & Dana along with the other instructors make sure you understand what you need to do, how to do it and keep you motivated throughout the challenging but fun hour of working out which starts off on land with an abs workout that they switch out from class to class and trust me, this isn't your run of the mill abs workout as it will leave you sore regardless of your level.  Make sure you come prepared with goggles that suction to your face as well as a pair of fins (if you have them already, if not there are bins for you to borrow fins for class, if needed).  If you're looking to switch up your workouts and add some training if you're planning to do triathlons, this is the boot camp for you and I highly recommend it and it's quite affordable!

about:
HIIT House LA is a 50 minute HIIT (high intensity interval training) program.

Each class is separated into 3 circuits of 3 Exercises (performed for a minute each), that you will complete 3 times. Why repeat the same exercise 3 times?  It often takes a minute to truly master proper form.
We want you safe and working efficiently! So, first round of the circuit is all about getting the form down, second is about about getting stronger and the third time through is about crushing the exercises.
The workouts are presented in two flavors:

BUILD: 

Whether your goal is hypertrophy (gaining muscle mass) or long and lean muscles, this is the class for you!  You will be put through 3 circuits of 3 exercises 3 times!
This means you get 3 touches on each exercise to truly master the lift  and exhaust the muscle group.  This translates to big gains!

SHRED: 

The name says it all.  This total body class is High-intensity interval training (HIIT) at it's best!  You will be put through intervals of high-intensity exercise followed by low intensity exercises.
These workout are designed to burn the fat away!  Come get shredded!

Each class ends with abs and stretching

I know, I know! In a world of 35 minute workouts, why is our workout sooooo long?  I'm glad you asked!  We include a warm-up, HIIT workout, abs, annnnnnd stretching.
text: Overall a very positive vibe, a great gym for all skill levels and the perfect way to start the morning.  Thank you for the warm welcome, awesome workout and I will see you all again soon!!

text: i love the instruction here. they don't just shout aimlessly into the room but they actually care about you and help correct your form. zach was my trainer and he was very patient with everyone! hiit house definitely sets the bar versus others i've visited. it's not to say the workouts were easy, it's tough! the class is a good mix of beginners to athletes so don't be afraid to come in. it's a friendly and encouraging environment. they have a one week free trial without any pressure or gimmicks so you have nothing to lose! (except lbs) haha.

HIIT House LA is a 50 minute HIIT (high intensity interval training) program.

Each class is separated into 3 circuits of 3 Exercises (performed for a minute each), that you will complete 3 times. Why repeat the same exercise 3 times?  It often takes a minute to truly master proper form.
We want you safe and working efficiently! So, first round of the circuit is all about getting the form down, second is about about getting stronger and the third time through is about crushing the exercises.
The workouts are presented in two flavors:

BUILD: 

Whether your goal is hypertrophy (gaining muscle mass) or long and lean muscles, this is the class for you!  You will be put through 3 circuits of 3 exercises 3 times!
This means you get 3 touches on each exercise to truly master the lift  and exhaust the muscle group.  This translates to big gains!

SHRED: 

The name says it all.  This total body class is High-intensity interval training (HIIT) at it's best!  You will be put through intervals of high-intensity exercise followed by low intensity exercises.
These workout are designed to burn the fat away!  Come get shredded!

Each class ends with abs and stretching

I know, I know! In a world of 35 minute workouts, why is our workout sooooo long?  I'm glad you asked!  We include a warm-up, HIIT workout, abs, annnnnnd stretching.
text: HIIT House LA is an outstanding HIIT gym in every way!  The coaches are dedicated, credentialed professionals who care about the clients' fitness goals and safety and continuously monitor for correct form.  The studio is large and bright and immaculate, with a never ending supply of towels, disinfecting wipes and filtered water.  The workouts are programmed to give the results you want while having fun at the same time.  The welcoming, uplifting and motivating spirit of the coaches is empowering.   I cannot rave about this HIIT House LA enough.  Come try it and you'll see what I mean.

text: I really enjoyed this class. I signed up for the 1 week free, and I like how they don't pressure you or send you a bunch of emails to sign up. They have classes ranging from early morning to evening, and the classes all seemed about the perfect size. You can sign up ahead of time online for a specific class. I am thinking about signing up because I really like the mix of weights, cardio and abs. It was challenging yet do-able. The instructor was great, super friendly and supportive. I like how the workouts changed from class to class and weren't the same ones. There are 9 stations and you do each one 3 times for 1min, and then you do abs as a group at the end. One station for example you would ride a stationary bike, and another station you would lift arm weights. There is a water fountain and free towels to use. The only big down side is I wished they had a parking lot. I live close enough to where I could walk but parking around there is very difficult.

text: Like many others, I found HIIT House through Class Pass and have been completely blown away by how genuinely warm and encouraging all of the instructors are. Instructors truly make or break the workout experience for me and HIIT House really has a knack for finding the best ones. They're obviously knowledgeable and in great shape themselves, but more importantly, they are enthusiastic, dedicated, and above all, welcoming to all folks of different shapes, sizes, and fitness levels. If you're looking for a truly inclusive studio where you can learn to really enjoy working out and make some tangible changes to your body, whatever your goals may be, this is the place to do it!

text: Ok I rarely write reviews on yelp,  but I needed to find a way to show my gratitude for Steven,  Aaron, Kinsey, and everyone at HIIT House.  So they opened up shop right below the office I worked in and while I was walking past,  Steven greeted me with the biggest warmest smile and invited me to try it out.   I was like, why the hell not?  Im 36 and overweight, slightly depressed, low energy and lazy.  IF I CANT MAKE IT TO A GYM RIGHT UNDERNEATH MY OFFICE THEN I DESERVE MY FATE LOL.

text: Hiit House hits it out of the park! After training with Steven at another local gym and absolutely loving the experience, I knew I had to go in for a sweat session when I heard he opened up his very own gym. This place has everything you need when it comes to circuit training. It's a powerful and quick workout that will leave you panting on the floor, but it's guaranteed that you'll be back for more. The location is convenient with parking in the back and on the street. Inside is spacious, clean and organized. But the best part has to be the camaraderie amongst the trainers and their members; it's infectious! Give Hiit House a try, you won't regret it!

text: I'm not one who typically takes the time to write a review but when I experience something that blows my already high expectations out of the water, I make the time.  And a workout at HIIT House LA is one of those experiences.  I joined the gym a little over two months ago and couldn't be happier with the results.   I've attended two to three classes a week since that time and have lost a total of 9 pounds not to mention the fact that I've become noticeably (according to my wonderful girlfriend) more toned.  What I think separates HIIT House LA from the other gyms I've joined are the incredible instructors(who also manage to somehow remember everyone's name).  Most of my classes have been with Aaron, Kinsey and Steven and with their combination of enthusiasm, high-energy and occasional sarcasm the workouts are a blast!   And it seems you will never do the same workout twice no matter how many times you attend which always keeps it interesting. In addition, I travel extensively on business every week and anyone else who does can attest to the fact that most hotel gyms leave a lot to be desired.  But with all of the new exercises I've learned from the wonderful staff at HIIT House LA I can turn virtually any gym into a workout mecca.  So if you're looking for a really FUN and equally EFFECTIVE workout routine, HIIT House LA is definitely the place you want to be!

text: HIIT House LA is my favorite place to work out in town. The instructors are incredibly motivating, knowledgeable and fun. The vibe is super friendly and not intimidating at all, even for a first timer. Each workout is different but the structure is always the same (3 circuits of 3 exercises repeated 3 times each so a total of 27 stations). I love that I always know exactly how much I have left to do. It also helps that you keep moving around so you never get bored. If you try it you'll get addicted to the great workout and the community vibe.

text: I've been coming to HIIT House weekly for over 6 months now via ClassPass and I'm OBSESSED. I've always done HIIT work outs but no other class has ever given me the results that HIIT House has. I've kept my diet pretty much the same, and come here about 2-3 times a week and have lost 10 lbs! They structure the work outs in a way where you burn tons of calories but also tone at the same time which is key. All of the instructors are so amazing, really focus on helping you with your form, very energetic, and they play the best music. My favorite instructor is Aaron, but they're all fantastic. The work out is great for all levels because they provide modifications for each exercise to make it easier or harder dependent on level of experience. It's honestly the best and they treat all of their members really well and the gym has a great family vibe. I highly recommend if you're thinking about trying it, and the best part is for first time goers, they give you a full free week to make sure you like it! Seriously awesome, love this place and I'm sure you will too!

text: I'm a fan of pretty intense workouts where you feel pushed to work hard and leave feeling like you've accomplished something - Orange Theory and Sweat Garage have been my go-tos in the past. But now I'm moving HIIT House to the top of that list. There are 3 circuits of 3 exercises that you do for one minute each with a 15 second break in between. One station in each circuit is the air assault bike. I love this format because the bike keeps your heart rate up and the other stations are super challenging exercises, but because it's just a minute you can trick yourself into thinking that you can do anything for a minute, right? I also like that I get to revisit each station 3 times so that I feel like I've really mastered that specific exercise/muscle group before I move on. And then there's 5-10 minutes of abs at the end and you're out of there in under an hour. Finally, the price is right. It's $99/month unlimited through the summer, then $149/month starting in the fall. That is significantly cheaper than other boutique fitness studios of its kind.

about: Welcome to Orangetheory Fitness, the energizing group interval fitness concept that is sweeping the nation! Orangetheory Fitness is a one-of-a-kind workout broken into intervals of cardiovascular and strength training, using a variety of equipment including treadmills, rowing, TRX straps, and free weights to tone your body and gain energy throughout the day.
text: I have not been in a gym for over 2 years and I forgot my training routine and gained several pounds during my gym hiatus.  I spoke with JD, the manager, in the summer time and he was very polite.   He explained the process and concept of the gym.  It sounded great and living a two minute walking distance from this gym, I joined.  Joining this gym has been the best step to get back on my path to health and fitness.  The coaches are outstanding and very professional.  The class workouts cover different body parts.  I have told several of my friends and family members to join.  The other gym in my area not only push memberships but push their personal trainers which will cost hundreds and in some cases thousands of dollars a month.  I get the best workout here at Orangetheory fitness with their coaches for a fraction of the cost and an excellent workout! Plus I like that they have tv monitors showing the work out routine and form! Their coaches are very approachable during class with any questions and concerns.  Great gym, so happy they opened in my neighborhood!

text: Best workout ever! HIIT training with great music and amazing coaches. I come out of each class drenched and ready to start the day. I love the location, parking is easy and the staff is super friendly. Love being part of the OTF family!

text: I have been an athlete since I was five years old up until my last year of playing college soccer. Since then, it's been hard for me to attend the gym because I am used to playing on a team. I have tried various types of gyms but have always experienced a lack of support and motivation and it made it hard for me to attend the gym. It wasn't until I began goi going to Orange Theory did I have a completely different experience with exercising. Orange Theory is the most motivating, encouraging, and family oriented fitness center that I have ever been a part of. I feel like I am on a team again! The classes are quick and target every area of your body. I leave seeing AMAZING and so accomplished. The staff are so loving and welcoming. They get to know you personally and care deeply about your health. Josh and Whitney at the West Hollywood location are sons of the coolest people I have spoken too. You will love your Orange Theory experience!

text: Love this place. Been going since it opened in Oct 2015. Great and consistent workouts. Hard enough to sweat but not too hard where you don't want to come back. Clean. Good people. Couldn't recommend OTF Weho more.

text: I absolutely love this place - As all of the other reviews mentioned, it's a fun, fast-paced, full body workout that burns tons of calories. The space is huge, the equipment is new and clean and the instructors are knowledgable and helpful...While they're all great, my favorites are Bruce and Mikey. There are tons of classes and validated (free) parking. The front desk staff is super gracious and has even helped me to sneak into a full class! I bounce back and forth to the Melrose location, as most of the instructors teach at both studios so you really can't go wrong...I just find myself trying to schedule my classes with my favorite instructors! Whether you're new to working out or you're an advanced athlete, you'll be challenged and entertained! Try it!

text: Joined OTF WeHo when it opened and LOVE it. I'm more of a 'french fries over exercise' kind of girl so I don't have a lot of knowledge or experience when working out alone in a gym but can feel a little self conscious in group classes. This studio made me feel welcomed and actually enjoy a high intensity workout. The concept allows you to focus on your body and heart rate to work against your own ability versus that of others yet still has the comradery of a group class while you all sweat your faces off. The space is new and clean, the music is energetic and loud, and the trainers are experienced and approachable. They also have a vast amount of knowledge to help those with injuries or limitations to still achieve a well-rounded workout in an hour. The classes are high energy, challenging and have a lot of variety that makes for a fun experience each time you attend. Definitely recommended to anyone looking for a place to start and those searching for a new challenge.

text: I love this gym!!!! I mean, I hate it because my body is out of shape and this place is hard work, but I can already see and feel a difference and it has only been open a couple weeks. The instructors are very enthusiastic and make you want to work harder throughout the entire workout. If you are like me and need that extra push instead of leisurely working out on an elliptical everyday, this place is great! All of the equipment is new and the entire staff is friendly and upbeat! I am also a fan of the apparel!

text: This workout is INTENSE! I've tried it all- I did class pass for over two years when I lived in NY. I've never done anything as hard or gratifying as this workout. It's really tough but doable and motivates me to push myself to my limits. Both the endurance class and Drew's class are fantastic workouts. I highly recommend for anyone looking for a challenging workout!!

text: This place is awesome.  I don't even like working out and I look forward to my next workout here.  The coaches are tremendous - always paying attention to each person and correcting form, offering options when necessary and just motivating you to push yourself that little bit extra.  The classes are also welcoming - I was way out of shape when I started and none of the instructors or other people in class ever made me feel uncomfortable.  And the staff is super friendly.  Can't recommend it enough!

text: I love OTF and I'm so glad my friend introduced me to the workout. The classes deserve a 5 star rating but I'm giving 4 stars because of no towel service. Staff is very friendly. Parking is easy and free in the garage underneath.

text: I joined OTF WeHo when they first opened in Oct/Nov 2015, and it has been a consistently awesome place to workout since. The studio is super clean, staff are really friendly and always happy to help, it's very easy to communicate with them via phone, email or txt - yes txt! There are plenty of lockers with combos to store your things, bathrooms are clean and have great amenities and there are two showers as well. The managers Josh and JD are awesome, and very friendly, helpful and supportive.

text: There is no better workout in LA! I've never seen results like this before, and I've tried everything in LA. Every day is a different workout which is amazing because I tend to get bored in classes. In every class you run, row, and use weights and TRX straps, and your body definitely feels it! The best part of OTF is the staff. The coaches are amazing. They encourage and push you every day while making the class fun! Jess, Drew, Mike, and Erin are awesome coaches!!! I just competed in an OTF event on Sunday and Jess was there with me every step of the way. She never stopped encouraging and believing in me... she made me feel like I could do anything! Thank you OTF WH for being amazing and keeping me in the best shape of my life!

text: I came in from out of town and wanted to try this place! They had a special to try a class so I did! This class was AMAZING! Everything from the moment we called to make an appt to the time the class ended it was nothing short of a great atmosphere, great customer service and a great concept! I would highly recommend this place! If i lived here there would be no doubt I would be a regular member!

text: i only tried one class, but i had a great time here--they helped me get set up (make sure to get there early), parking was easy, and i'm not sure i'll be back but i definitely had fun and felt motivated by the individual heartrate monitor. i went to an afternoon class and it was packed, it seemed like most people who were there knew one another and the instructors pretty well, so it was a comfortable environment.

text: I have nothing but praise for the staff and facilities at the West Hollywood OTF studio.  I have heard from friends in Seattle about the programs at the OTF clubs up there. I travel to LA often and wanted to check-out the program.  Preston showed me around the studio and explained the training model to me very clearly.  I took the complimentary class the next day and I was hooked.  Since I travel between two cities the 10 pack seemed like the best option for me.  I appreciate the personal attention from coaches Nick and Drew that made the first two class a positive, if draining experience  (that is the point right) and Hayley at the front desk.  The real-time heart rate/splat stats are both helpful and motivating.  The studio has two private shower/changing room that are impeccably clean.  Parking is convenient in the garage below the building, and at least for my 3 visits was free.  All in all a great experience!

text: I love Orange Theory Fitness, and the staff really cares and pays attention to my workouts.  It's like having a personal trainer every day.  I have tried many different gyms, workouts, and classes, and this has kept my interest, as it changes the type of workout every day.  I've improved so much since I started in January, and have come a long way in terms of my stamina and strength.  I also love the fact that they have locations everywhere that I can use if I need to.  I highly recommend Orange Theory Fitness!!!

text: Warning: this the crack cocaine of the exercise world. I was wandering down Sunset Blvd minding my own business, and I saw the Orange glow and glazed eyes of smiling people spilling out of the garish OT shopfront. I thought to myself, I need a little taste, you know, "I'll have what they're having" When Harry Met Sally-style; what harm can it do, says I? So I dragged myself in and took a puff. I swear I didn't inhale. But then those pushers got me hooked: that Mike and Drew and Whitney and Bruce are dangerous, handing out their own brand of candy. Josh the Kingpin got it all started. At first, splat points are so easy to come by, and then you need more and more and more OT just to get a baseline high. And it feels soooo good...

text: GREAT full body workout whether you're an athlete or just beginning your fitness journey. Instructors guide the class through a different workout each day with modification options for each exercise to protect injuries or to challenge more experienced participants, so you're able to get an individualized workout in a group setting. I absolutely love the real-time heart rate monitoring on multiple overhead screens. The visual helps motivate me to push harder than I normally would. I've taken classes with every trainer at this location, and they're ALL great!! If you're looking for a full body workout in a motivating and non-intimidating environment at a very reasonable cost, I HIGHLY recommend Orange Theory Fitness and especially this West Hollywood location. I actually enjoy working out now, and I've received multiple compliments from friends on noticeable body toning after only 3 months.

text: So when I first saw these guys (JD "blue eyes" and Josh) out around town I was not sure... Heart rate monitors, splat points, etc... Wtf....?

text: Great workout, nice facility, clean, and excellent employees and trainers!

text: I was looking for a change from my equinox membership which I had for over 7 years. My friend recommended orange theory because they found it to be effective and I liked the idea of using my own heart rate as my measurement and guide. Although it did take some effort to find a class i could attend initially, the front desk was very helpful in giving a nice warm welcome plus some extra care to ease me into the unknown. I loved the format and concept. Unfortunately my heart rate monitor wasn't picking up correctly so we found a device that was better for me. In all I've never had an accurate depiction of my workouts and now I know I can't fake it and stay in my comfort zone. I also love it's different every class. Also I use the monitor at my outside activities and the app is great in tracking it.

text: I started with OT over a year ago bc I needed a change and heard so much about about it but didn't really know what it was. I tried a session and have been hooked since. I really love the work out as it challenges me every time but beyond that I love the coaches here and the studio. Everyone is so great and friendly. It feels like home and I love coming here.

text: This is my second time at Orange theory fitness and at a different location but again I had an amazing workout.the staff are nice, the coaches are on point with their coaching and the way they set up the workouts, know you will come out drenched in sweat.

text: I absolutely adore the trainers and classes. I have to give a huge thx u to Jonathan A. for leading the running class. He was encouraging and very engaging, verifying if I was comfortable. He pushed me and showed me how to breathe during a long run and relax my mind. The regular workout classes are so addictive and a blast. Thx u Orangetheory : )

text: Visiting here from Portland. We were nervous but the staff was amazing welcoming us and making us feel so comfortable. And WHITNEY ROCKS. amazing coach. Knows her stuff, very entertaining and pushes you!!! We will come back here every time We are in LA.

text: You gotta try it! The nicest trainers ever! Great workout for all fitness levels and ages because it is heart rate based and highly individualized. I have several injuries and the trainers always help modify exercises so I can participate fully and get a great workout. The trainers are in outstanding shape (I mean one was an NFL player for 13 years, how cool is that?!?) they really foster an inclusive gym environment of cooperation not competition. Truly the best $ that I spend every month. THANKS OTF!

text: Jess and the whole staff were awesome! I was visiting from a different location and I didn't know I couldn't use a loner for free but they waived the cost anyway. Jess pushed me, called me out by name and was attentive to everyone throughout the class. Only downfall was that many of the classes I was interested in had wait lists.. Seems like a common problem among OTFs

text: I started Orangetheory last fall and was instantly hooked.  After trying everything, I finally found the perfect workout! It's fantastic to be able to work at my own pace and challenge myself every day. Regardless of the size of the class (that varies depending on the time of day), the coaches are skilled, enthusiastic, and driven.....always keeping you moving, sweating, and safe. The West Hollywood team is amazing! They have pushed me to places I've never thought I could go. Every day is a different workout, which keeps you engaged and challenged...but never bored. And, of course, there are the results.... Serious results! I've dropped over 2 sizes since I stared, and haven't felt this fit in decades!

text: Great workout!!  Awesome program that is easy to jump into!  Research backed & fun!  Clever biofeedback that enables you to maximize your workout, avoid burnout and create a healthy habit.

text: I've been doing OTF for about two months now and have upgraded from the basic membership all the way up to the unlimited because it works so well and I love it!  I remember I took my first class with a friend after not exercising regularly for about two years and was so sore for 4 days that I could barely walk.  Now I go at least three times a week!  I've taken OTF classes at 3 different studios and can attest that OTF WeHo is the place to go!  The coaches and front desk staff are always helpful and definitely fun to talk to.  These are definitely the most personable people I've ever met and have really helped make LA home.  If the community surrounding OTF WeHo don't motivate you to work your hardest during workouts I don't know what will!  I have set multiple PRs at this studio and would recommend it to all.

text: I'm loving everything about OTF.  Workouts are never the same, so I am never bored. Music is always on point. Instructors are always there to guide you, push you and correct your posture.  Heart rate monitor is the ultimate plus for me. I know exactly what I'm burning every second of the class. Very clean studio and the entire staff are always so friendly.  If you haven't already, give this place a try!

text: I LOVE everything about this gym. The cleanliness, the customer service, and the workout! My favorite part is my workout summary is emailed to me after every workout.

text: I went to my first class Monday night and was really happy with my all around service. The front desk was very helpful, informative and welcoming. The class was great and I especially loved the rowing machine. I ended up signing up for a package and plan on making this an every week part of my work out routine!

text: Orangetheory is the best fitness studio I've ever been to. The classes are unreal! They constantly challenge me but are also super motivating and fun. Delvon has helped me so much on my form and Erin is my go to gal on Friday nights! The front desk staff at this location are the coolest. Preston is one of the sweetest guys there (not to mention incredibly dreamy). The studio is very welcoming and brings positivity to an activity which I normally would consider a chore.

text: When class pass took away their unlimited option, I needed to find something that was affordable yet beneficial. Orange Theory is probably one of the toughest workouts I have done, I've also seen results! I hate running on the treadmills but the heart monitor component really pushes be to work harder than any other workout around. Plus, the coaches are top notch and I haven't had a repeat workout yet! I would for sure recommend this to friends!!

text: OT Sunset location is awesome!!! From the staff to the trainers to the clients. Mike and Drew and Phil are the trainers I sweat with the most. They keep it fun and motivating and have made me strong enough to move cars...! Not sure when I'll need that skill but living in LA it's got to come in handy. The crew I tend to workout with in my time slots drive me to be as competitive as I want to be on any given day. Can't say enough. If you haven't tried Orange Theory, you're missing out. Come sweat with us!

text: I just started here two weeks ago and I'm already down 5lbs. This place is dope and the staff is cool AF.

text: Just started coming here recently and I'm hooked! Such a great workout that makes you feel great afterwards. Something that is really important to me is early class times and they have them! I've been going to the 530am class and really enjoy it. The staff is great as well. So happy to have found this place!

about: Welcome to Orangetheory Fitness, the energizing group interval fitness concept that is sweeping the nation! Orangetheory Fitness is a one-of-a-kind workout broken into intervals of cardiovascular and strength training, using a variety of equipment including treadmills, rowing, TRX straps, and free weights to tone your body and gain energy throughout the day.
text: What's not to like? You can get a body burning workout in about 55 minutes without really thinking about it.  They guide you through everything.  Example:  6 minutes Treadmill, 6 minutes Water Rower, 6 minutes TRX & Weights, then repeat- but with 8 minute intervals on each.  The last portion is a wholehearted complete body and TRX workout with the instructor right there to assist, as well as screens overhead showing you exactly what to do. Having the calorie burning / cardio monitor show up above the workout space is truly motivating.  I didn't think it would be - but it is!  And what really makes the whole experience so satisfying?  The other "classmates" are all super supportive & genuine - no stepford snobbiness or roid necks here.  The staff is also wonderfully informative and helpful - And did I mention the garage parking?  Yay!

text: I love the workouts regardless to age, fitness status or ability you are treated as part of the team the coaches are friendly and extremely helpful. Best work outs I have ever completed.

about: Welcome to Orangetheory Fitness, the energizing group interval fitness concept that is sweeping the nation! Orangetheory Fitness is a one-of-a-kind workout broken into intervals of cardiovascular and strength training, using a variety of equipment including treadmills, rowing, TRX straps, and free weights to tone your body and gain energy throughout the day.
text: I originally came across Orange Theory at the Melrose Farmers Market in West Hollywood last year. I was a little skeptical at first to try it out because group workouts were never really my thing. My roommate insisted that I give it a try especially considering the close proximity to my apartment! The phrase you never know until you try could never be more true. I was given the opportunity to try 3 classes for free before they officially opened the studio and I was HOOKED! Becoming a member at OTF was a no brainer for me. Each class feels like a personal training session even though you are working out with a group of people. The coaches are very well trained, knowledgable, and super fit, which is extremely important to me! There is nothing worse than going to a class where I can't take the instructor seriously! My personal favorites are Jessica and Drew. They bring amazing energy to each class, correct my form if I am not doing something right, play awesome music, and keep me pumped the entire 60 minutes of class. Also always pushing me to my limits. Nick is the most inspirational person I have ever met, easily! Don't even think about using the words "I can't" around him! The coaches will get to know you on a first name basis and they really strive to get you to where you want to be in terms of your fitness goals. I really haven't taken a coach at this location that I did not like. I ended up trying an Orange Theory class in a different part of California and I will say this location is the best of the best. We are truly spoiled and blessed in Los Angeles when it comes to fitness!

about: Welcome to Orangetheory Fitness, the energizing group interval fitness concept that is sweeping the nation! Orangetheory Fitness is a one-of-a-kind workout broken into intervals of cardiovascular and strength training, using a variety of equipment including treadmills, rowing, TRX straps, and free weights to tone your body and gain energy throughout the day.
text: I love this workout.  It is hard, but in a fun way.  Everyone works out at their own pace, so both beginners and accomplished athletes will get a workout that works for them.  The coaches, office staff and fellow gym members are super nice and friendly.  I have been attending four classes a week for about nine months, and consider it my home away from home.

about: Welcome to Orangetheory Fitness, the energizing group interval fitness concept that is sweeping the nation! Orangetheory Fitness is a one-of-a-kind workout broken into intervals of cardiovascular and strength training, using a variety of equipment including treadmills, rowing, TRX straps, and free weights to tone your body and gain energy throughout the day.
text: I am obsessed with OTF and just wanted to write a review for anyone who hasn't tried it yet. Trust me try it! This is the best thing in fitness!

about: Welcome to Orangetheory Fitness, the energizing group interval fitness concept that is sweeping the nation! Orangetheory Fitness is a one-of-a-kind workout broken into intervals of cardiovascular and strength training, using a variety of equipment including treadmills, rowing, TRX straps, and free weights to tone your body and gain energy throughout the day.
text: I've been going to Orange Theory for about 3 months now and it's not only the best workout I've ever had, it's also the best gym experience!  From the front desk staff (Dylan, Emily, Tamara, Haley to name a few) to the management, I've had nothing but great interactions.  They're always friendly and helpful with everyone I've seen walk through the doors.  There is absolutely no pretense within the doors which sets the gym apart from most gyms/fitness studios in LA.  And this is all before you even start a workout!

about: Welcome to Orangetheory Fitness, the energizing group interval fitness concept that is sweeping the nation! Orangetheory Fitness is a one-of-a-kind workout broken into intervals of cardiovascular and strength training, using a variety of equipment including treadmills, rowing, TRX straps, and free weights to tone your body and gain energy throughout the day.
text: OTF is incredibly difficult, and that's how I know it's good. I leave every workout exhausted and knowing that the hour I spent was well worth it. If you want an intense, all out workout and feel confident doing it, then OTF is a great place for you.

about:
The Workouts:

Introducing Pound!: Pound is a full-body cardio jam session, combining light resistance with constant simulated drumming. The workout fuses cardio, Pilates, isometric movements, plyometrics and Isometric poses into a 45-minute series. Burn between 600 and 900 calories per hour, strengthen and sculpt infrequently used muscles, and drum your way to a leaner, slimmer physique - all while rocking out to your favorite music!

Endurance Pilates:  55 minute group class on customized Pilates Reformers. Strength and endurance training, core and stability activation, full body workout. It burns, tones and promotes lean long muscles.

The Mashup:  25 minutes of Cardio Intervals on treadmills. Raises your heart rate, taxes your cardio-vascular system, gets you real sweaty and burns calories. Then hop on our customized Reformers for 30 minutes of Endurance Pilates.       *Options for Beginners, Intermediate and Advanced runners
text: After my original review Diana (one of the owners) contacted me asking for feedback and offering me a chance to come back and try another class for free...I did not take her up on her offer at the time because I found another place to go but I did appreciate her reaching out.  A few months ago I was looking for a change as the place I've been going has really gone down hill and I thought why not give Fitmix another chance. Almost a year later Diana still made good on her offer to let me try a class again free of charge which I thought was amazing.  I took a class with a different instructor and he was great! Once again I did the mash-up class and I felt the instructor was really paying close attention to everyone but still having fun.  I am also happy to report that the first thing he did was ask me if I had any injuries! Fitmix seems to be a really nice and supportive community and not just a place to take classes. I'm really glad I gave it another chance and kudos to Diana for reaching out to me and welcoming feedback to make the studio the best it can be. As soon as I can get my schedule together I will be back for some more of that Fitmix goodness.

text: This is a MUCH OVERDUE review/shout out to Fitmix that I should have written after one session of coming here. 5 stars don't even come close to how great this place is! This is my story and the reasons I'll forever be obsessed with Fitmix. I never enjoyed working out. I felt it was boring, time consuming and every weird method I tragically attempted I just ended up feeling stupid and I couldn't stick with anything. After a while I sort of gave up, but then joined Equinox (just never went) and was upset about how much weight I had put on over that past year with stress and working so much. I overheard some girls at my friends tanning salon talking about this awesome place called Fitmix where they took Pilates saying how great it was. I got the info and walked in blind never taking Pilates in my life for the free trial class they offer. Most places also after your "free session" you feel obligated and awkward because they try and immediately sell you a package, but not this place in ANY way! The environment, instructors, other clients, music, and everything about Fitmix sells itself bottom line. I became hooked and felt before my classes ended I already wanted to come again. I  ended up coming 3-4 times on average a week, and not only did it get me into loving fitness (which I thought was completely impossible) but the weight just came off ... a little over 15 pounds in 3-4 months and I've kept it off. Most important I don't care about the number of what I weight its that I feel stronger in every muscle of my body and it just showed me the trick is to never give up. Talking to other clients here everyone had different goals and reasons for coming here and the instructors accommodate everyone in the class accordingly and make you all feel motivated! My best friend also started coming with me and she loved this place just as much as I do. I'm a firm believer that the people MAKE the gym or wherever you go, and this place is a perfect example of that. Every instructor here is absolutely amazing, genuine, hilarious and so motivating you really can't have a bad experience no matter who you take a class from. I recently moved to New York and totally am having Fitmix withdrawals and can't imagine even going somewhere else to take Pilates! So anyone that went to Fitmix and moved to the east coast should start a petition with me to get Diana to open up a studio in New York because my life would be complete and it would do SOOOO well!!!!!!!! I miss all of you here so much!! XOXO :)

text: I am a sometimes-runner who has been practicing pilates regularly (4-5 times per week) for about 3 years.  Over the past year or so I've had the pleasure of training with Brian and Diana; they became my 2 favorite trainers so I was devastated when I learned they were leaving the studio at which I work out.  My frown turned upside down though when I heard they were opening their own studio.  I was even more excited when I learned that they would offer straight pilates classes AND a class combining pilates and treadmill intervals.  I'll admit that I was also a little intimidated by the latter although there was no need for this.  My first "Mashup" class, on opening day with Diana, was as challenging as I expected but Diana's training style, in addition to the great music, made the time fly and, before I knew it, the class was over and I felt amazing!  I haven't had the opportunity to take one of Brian's Mashup classes yet but am signed up for this week.  Can't wait!  Brian and Diana have the unique ability to make you want to push your body and your mind past the point you initially thought possible.   Try it...they offer a free first class to everyone!

text: During the last couple of years, I have taken Pilates Plus classes all over the city.  Two of my all time favorite instructors are Diana and Brian.  I was thrilled when they decided to open this studio, particularly because it is way more reasonably priced than the Pilates Plus 90210 studio and I don't have to deal with the horrible woman that runs that studio (Lexi), anymore.  Diana is a very tough instructor, but nurturing and really listens to the needs of her students.  Both she and Brian have been really accomodating, dealing with my injuries and helping me to modify exercises so that I don't aggravate injuries.  Brian's class is the hardest I've ever been to.  I am dripping sweat by the end of the hour and am sore for the next two days.  But, I feel like I have pushed my body.  I love both of their classes and feel like taking a class with each of them, each week is a good balance.  I would so highly recommend this place.  Go, take the free class, you will not regret it!!!

about:
LIFT Society is the only boutique lifting gym where the focus is aesthetics. We are a semi-private training gym where class sizes range from 6-8 people per class. Our trainers are selected for their dedication, expertise and their constant drive to learn more in order to give our clients the best coaching available.
At LIFT Society you build muscle, increase metabolism, and create a toned and defined physique. We run a six week strength cycle with a focus on consistency and periodization as well as variety, so that your workouts are effective but never boring.
In light of the new COVID-19 safety regulations, there is no sharing of equipment and every client gets their own lifting rack, dumbbells, and kettlebells for the entirety of each class.
text: This gym changed my life. Dylan and Dave are amazing and the vibe is super unpretentious and welcoming. They push me and support me and the results have been amazing. I love it here.

text: I was a Classpass member for about a year and a half and discovered Lift Society. I was normally a big runner, Pilates, and Barre person. Lift Society stood out to me among other studios because unlike other lift-focused gyms, they emphasize the importance of FORM before trying to stack on the weights. They have a perfect variety of classes, if one would like more cardio they can take kettlebell. I personally love the Glutes and Total Lift classes. Just within 6 weeks of 4X a week, I saw massive results on my body that I've never seen before. Every instructor is supportive, encouraging, and always available to give advice and take your workouts to the next level-- all depending on your specific goals. I can now say I'm a happy member for the next year!

text: I've been a member of Lift Society (formerly Cross Train LA) for three years now. I've always found it a motivating, challenging gym with small classes that feel like personal training sessions. They started classes focused on Olympic Lifting and Heaving Lifting a year ago, and I fell in love. People are always scared of the idea of lifting because they're afraid of bulking up, but weight lifting gets you lean and strong. It's very empowering to exceed your personal expectations and realize how strong you really are, and how strong you can be. What Dave and Dylan do so well is that they tailor a program to students of all levels. In the Lift classes there are level two and three workouts that you can do, so everyone can work towards their own personal fitness goals. Lift Society fosters community and athleticism, and that's not something you can get with any other gym.

text: I have been training at Lift Society and with Dylan and Dave for a couple years. I love it so much that when I needed to move, I made sure I was still within easy walking/driving distance so I could continue taking the 6am classes before work and personal training after work. As background, I am a runner - marathons and half marathons -- and I've always loved fitness and have committed at times to pilates, boxing, cycling, etc. However, I have never been as toned and as strong as when I train at Lift Society. I make an effort to train consistently 3-4 times a week at Lift Society, run a couple times a week and do yoga every week or so. The Lift Society program has given me a great body shape and rounded out my fitness. The Lift Society body look is definitely the fitspo look that has taken over social media! Because I am building more muscle by lifting heavier, I am burning more calories when resting and I've found that as long as I am consistently training and primarily eating clean, I don't need to be super strict about my food portions and occasional treats like I used to be in order to maintain my fitness/shape. The trainers are experts in power and/or Olympic lifting and practice/compete in it in their free time. They are attentive to form, which is what produces results. Finally, Lift Society is primarily attended by members who had to express a genuine interest and commitment to sign up so you get to know like-minded people in your classes and develop a community that motivates attendance. It's a workout that I look forward to and always feel the next day!

text: Ive been working with Dyan and Dave for over 6 years.  After dual hip replacements, knee replacement and a rebuilt ankle, the work they have done with me is incredible.  My workouts are always changing and challenging. Functional exercise, that keeps me moving, healthy and strong.  I have full range of motion and am in the best shape ever.  All the trainers have a passion for health, fitness and are focused on an over well being. I highly recommend Lift Society for anyone who wants to feel great and energized. I always leave feeling pumped up for the day!

text: I can't say enough about this place! I found them via Class Pass about a year and a half ago. The first class I took I could barely walk for four days after, so I knew I had to come back. I had been wasting money going to Equinox 3x a week and just doing the elliptical. Dylan and David have taken my workouts to a new level and I see muscles I never knew I had. They are so friendly and professional, so now I still do Class Pass for my spin addiction but do all my other workouts here. I added some personal training sessions and recently perfected my deadlift! Who knew??? Dylan's helped me with my eating and uhem, drinking habits. Oh and if you're on the road a lot like I've been you can take some of these workouts on the road and do them in your hotel room or cabana...

text: Visited this gym on a recent trip to LA and absolutely loved it. While the studio is on the smaller side, it is clean with a posh feel and is extremely well appointed. The classes are small making the space the perfect fit for weight training. The instructor was very helpful, always demonstrating correct form while pushing class participants to go to the next level of strength and endurance. I took the Sweat class which definitely lived up to its name. Really nice mix of cardio weight training with body weight challenges (pull ups, burpees) and a fun, attentive atmosphere. Loved the burpees to "Roxanne" finishing fix! Keep up the great work.

Class size is never too large  so plenty of personal attention so I'm seeing rapid improvement which is great!

text: This place is incredible!! I have mainly done HIIT workouts in the past as I felt that it was most effective for fat and weight loss but ever since I found Lift through classpass, I've been hooked!!  Classes are super tough and I leave each class feeling super wobbly and gassed out!! After every workout, I'm sore for at least 3-4 days.  I feel like my body had plateaued with the HIIT workouts and I'm finally starting to see my body change again with the lifting and also beginning to build more strength. Getting the form down is tough at first but the members and instructors are pretty cool and are not at all intimidating. I've been coming here for about 2 months now and it has to be my favorite gym to go to. Highly recommend this place!!

text: Kettle bells class with Dylan, woah what a workout!  In addition to being a surprisingly amazing cardio workout, I could not walk for 3-4 days after!  It was a bit intimidating walking into a serious weight lifting gym, but Dylan immediately put me at ease.  Only my second kettle bells class ever, Dylan offered great tips for handling the weights and corrected my form.  Even with the lightest weights (and I'm already fairly strong), the squats and lunges were so killer that my legs wobbled as I left class, and I felt the results for days.  For serious weight lifters, lots of opportunity to grow your muscles and develop your body here.  I look forward to my next class with Dylan!
