text: LIFT Society was my second home while I lived in Hollywood. I'm sad that I had to give up my membership when I moved away. The owners are smart, talented, and experts in their field. This studio attracts highly skilled trainers who put clients through the wringer without compromising on form. I'm so grateful to have been part of this wonderful community.

about: Fitness M specializing in unique personal training.
text: So I called this place because I wanted to join a gym that wasn't packed because I have anxiety when it comes to the gym. I asked and the lady just answered "yes?". Bad start. I asked if they still do the three day memberships. "Yes." That was everything I was told, no further explanation. I asked another question and again all she said was "Yes" with no explanation. I told her that I am not familiar with gym equipment and that this would be the first gym I have joined, so I asked if it was possible for someone to show me how to use the equipment. She stared speaking to someone else in what I can only guess is Korean  and then just said "No". One word responses for everything, absolutely cold and no friendliness.what a terrible way to Try and convince someone to join their gym. Definitely not joining this one.

about: Fitness M specializing in unique personal training.

text: Great for people who just want to get a good workout.  In and out.  Clean with excellent equipment.  Parking is a problem but that's because the mall became so popular.

about: Fitness M specializing in unique personal training.
text: Fitness M has everything I needed to use while on vacation with my girlfriend in LA.  We were open about the fact that we wouldn't be signing up and they still gave us 3 day passes for free.  The entire place was very clean including the locker rooms (in fact they were fantastically finished), and all the staff members were kind.  If I lived in LA I would probably get a membership.  The only reason that's a probably and not a definitely is that the largest Dumbbells they have are 50lbs.  However they have two power racks with very nice barbells.p which just about makes up for it.

text: This gym is awful, people working here is not respectful, the towel is dirty, and the floor is full of water, I fell down and broke my back bone, i think I will not come back here and I strongly do not recommend others to join in this gym

text: Super clean place.  Respectful gym goers.  Helpful trainers and staff.  The gym itself isn't huge, but it has all the essentials.  The locker room is constantly maintained and with a certain level of membership you receive freshly washed shorts and pants in your locker each visit.

about: Fitness M specializing in unique personal training.
text: This is the worst gym that I used, the staff are racists, they do not treat people as a customer, the trainers are cold, not eager to serve customers, what is worse, they make a joke of customer, I wish that I never back to this gym, and also I will tell everyone around me not to choose this gym.

about: Fitness M specializing in unique personal training.
text: I've been a member for 2 months now. i have been going to the gym mostly 3X a week and true to what I heard about the gym it is well maintained, clean, the staff were friendly if u are able to pick 'em apart from the rest of the members. Anyway, I am pretty much satisfied with the membership only for one glitch. when I signed up I was told that there will be 3 free sessions with the facility fitness trainors. that I will be contacted via my phone or email to schedule the said sessions. I received NO communications whatsoever going into my second week so I followed up with the reception and again they took my contact information and was promised that I will be receiving a call.or email from one of the trainors. Going 2 mos now and still no call from anybody in the facility. Well, I do not really care about having a trainor breathing down my neck while I am.working out. I had a personal trainor when I started working out a year or two ago so I am confident I have at least the basic know how on how to do things. I did not ask for this 3 free sessions, it must be a part of their marketing strategy to lure clients in so it may be a good idea to make sure that they follow up on their promises across their culturally diversed clients and not only to their fellow Koreans. I have other reasons why I picked the facility so I will be going there until I find a better place to go to (well, I am contracted up to a year lol).

about: Fitness M specializing in unique personal training.
text: Very clean place, nice gym with good yoga  instructor and trainers... But if there is changed schedules, they don't have external communication system like email to members let them know the changes. If you are not there last week, you don't know what's going on this week.

text: This is the best gym on the planet. I've spent my entire life trying to look in a way that I like. First I lost so much weight starving myself cause I didn't know how to do it, so I lost all my muscle too! Then I spent years trying to fix it, studying about nutrition and trying to understand how to put my muscle mass back on without gaining fat. A failure after the other. I've been doing cardio only and counting calories to an insane level for years, until my husband took me to Lift Society. I went only because I wanted to keep him company and try this together. When I found out how challenging it was and how interested I was into learning new movements and get stronger I couldn't stop anymore. I dropped any other sport and I started to lift 4 or 5 times a week, to see how far I could get, how could I fix my body, trusting my teachers because - let's say it - THEY LOOK SO GOOD! I trusted them and that was the best idea I've ever had. I train at Lift Society since 2 years, I lift way more than my own weight and, above all, I am the healthiest that I've ever been. I look the way I like and I don't care if my old pants don't fit anymore or my shirts are too tight on my arms. That's because I was able to fill them up with MUSCLE!

text: After two years of going to a class based yoga, HIITS, spin studio in Hollywood i found that my body was plateauing and was not seeing much change or progress. A friend signed up at Lift Society and was so excited so I decided to try the one month intro and see what he was talking about. If you're like me starting at a new gym is never easy, and I've always been intrigued and intimidated by weight lifting.  I had an initial meeting with Dylan and she was so lovely and took the time to walk mE through  all the lifts and discussed what my training goals were. Within that first month I could  see such  a difference in my body/strength and what shocked me the most was the mental change, strong body also equal a strong mind. Lift society trainers really care about technique and focus on the individuals, if you have an injury no problem they take the time to modified the movement so you are still able to do the work. It's been 4 months and I'm the strongest  I've ever been my body has never looked  like this no matter how much I trained.

text: I've struggled with my weight for years now and LIFT Society is the one place that gets me back up, even after I've fallen down, again and again... and again. Even if the number on the scale doesn't budge one week (totally my fault for bad nutrition), I can still feel myself getting stronger. I've never felt bored coming here and I know that once I really hold myself accountable, and can get my nutrition right, my body will make significant changes because of this place and it's trainers. I LOVE Dylan and Dave. They take pride in their business and it shows. They're both incredibly kind, supportive and informative. All of the trainers make you feel comfortable and welcomed. They're super in-tune with each member to ensure your form is correct, that you're not going to injure yourself, and that you're getting the most out of your workout. If you're looking for a place to make a serious change, and you're willing to commit, I highly recommend LIFT Society.

text: Look, if you want to go look fresh in your new Alo or Lululemon gear and maybe have a drop or two of sweat bead off of your forehead, join any of the HIIT gyms in Weho. If you actually want to get stronger, more fit, and feel better about yourself, join this gym. David and Dylan Schenk have designed such an amazing program that if you just show up on a regular basis, you will see results! I started going to LIFT Society at the end of May, and by late August I had put on about 25lbs of muscle. This gym also attracts the best crowd of people. I always hear supportive comments and general camaraderie from fellow class attendees and trainers. This is a happy healthy place and you should want to train here if you know what's good for you!!!!

text: This review is long overdue. I was a member for essentially two years. Lift Society is the place to train, whether you're completely new to lifting or a veteran of the iron game. I originally joined for Olympic Weightlifting but shifted towards more power building and aesthetics. Before joining this gym, I never directly trained my glutes. The new training methodology along with the coaching helped me hit new PRs in my squats and deadlifts. I also joined LS several months after I tore my pec while benching elsewhere, and having both a coach keeping an eye on it and having a spotter helped me feel confidently under the bar again when it comes bench presses. Dave and Dylan assembled an impressive coaching cadre and has created quite an awesome and welcoming community. All the coaches have their own styles, yet they also follow a consistent programming (quick shout out to Luci for drilling proper glute engagement when squatting as that has stuck with me to this day). Although I'm no longer a member (esp. considering that I live in another county now), I'd rejoin in a heartbeat if I return the area and the class schedule fits my crazy work schedule. When I was living in Burbank and before the Studio City location opened, I was making the commute over the hill (and on some days, during rush hour), and it was worth it due to the quality of the training. Highly recommend Lift Society overall! Great place to train for aesthetics and/or athletic performance.

about: We specialize in Technical Mittology Boxing Training that has been popularized by Floyd Money Mayweather. This style of mitt work is great for weight loss, toning, cardio endurance, and most importantly look like a pro-fighter without the sparring.
text: I got a session in with Ken and he is really great to work with. He made it more than just a workout but as well as knowing and understanding the proper technique! I was dripping sweat after and my brain was put to work from the combos he gave so... mission accomplished .

about: Founded by Jason Walsh, Rise Nation is the first 30 minute full body workout class on a Versaclimber. Our 30 minute workout activate all of the major muscle groups simultaneously, which has made it one Men's Health's of the top 10 workouts in the fitness industry. Our total body workout promotes proper spinal alignment, neuromuscular coordination and high calorie burn. The workout is zero impact and self regulating so all ages are encouraged to climb with us. Remember, even though our classes are only 30 minutes, our extreme workout has you working your entire body, a half-hour is all you need.  We offer three different Levels, and our West Hollywood, CA gym validates parking as well. Swing by, our first class is always free!
text: AMAZING killer work out! Adam was fantastic, great energy and an awesome instructor. He made me feel completely comfortable on the machine as a first-timer. The class is only 30 minutes long, but is one of the best work out classes I have done! It works your whole body and is very challenging, but fun. The 30 minute flies by and you leave feeling stronger and wanting to do it again! The studio is so beautiful and clean, and they have the most gorgeous roof deck outside the studio space. Everyone that works there is so friendly and helpful. Great energy in the whole studio! Loved the class, love Rise Nation, I can't wait to go back.

text: Great workout but the parlor trick they use of never turning on fans in the sweltering room so you'll sweat more and THINK you had a really intense workout is a sham. Hotter rooms don't improve workout performance - and the smell of old sweat that lingers in a stuffy room only makes it harder to focus on having a good workout.

text: I just went to Rise Nation and had the best workout experience I've ever had at a studio. The girl who greeted me at the front desk, Alex, was incredibly nice. We had a great 5 minute conversation and I felt like she was a friend by the time I was ready to go into class. Once I got in the class, the teacher, Adam, was so nice. He helped me set up because it was my first time, was encouraging me by name throughout the entire class,  and was completely motivating the entire time. He was dancing around and having so much fun throughout the class and you could tell he really loves what he does. The lighting in the studio and the music were incredible (a great variety of all different genres) and I felt like I was in a healthy night club having the time of my life. Everyone in the class was super nice and the workout was INTENSE cardio! I left feeling so warm and fuzzy I didn't want it to end. This studio is nothing but fun and positivity and I will definitely be purchasing more classes to go back!

text: I love this place! I've been to Adam, Nicolette and Alex and they are all fantastic. Honestly I'm someone who hates working out, so I think I really enjoy this class because it is only 30 minutes.  With that said, I would say it's much more challenging than a spin class.  The first couple times I was worried I would pass out, but with time it gets easier...and more addicting. There is a resistance knob on the machine, so if you are a newbie you can put less on if you're finding it really difficult.  Also the instructors are friendly and will explain the machine before you get started. I'm on classpass, but love it so much I'm considering just switching to rise for the unlimited pass. I'd highly recommend! It's a very unique workout that gets results.

text: You can do anything for 30 minutes! It's a tough workout, but stick with it until you get used to the movement, which you totally will. The facilities here are impeccably clean and the staff is welcoming and knowledgable. Be sure to tell a staff member that it's your first time and they'll give you a short but important demo of how to use the Versaclimber. (Your form on the machine is important.) My only downside is with the workout itself: It's a very personal experience and, because of the position you're in, there's very little interaction with the instructor or with people around you. That being said, you feel like a rock-star by the time the class is done.

text: Let me start by saying I have never been much into fitness, one of my friends I made, since moving to LA, has been a big encouragement for me to take back my health and fitness and feel good about my body. That led to me being invited to try out the classes at Rise Nation. I was nervous and worried that I would be in a room full of fit, pretty people and be self-conscious however that wasn't the case. Yes you will see lots of attractive fit people but you will meet people from all walks of life that are there to be healthy and encourage eachother. The trainers there are so warm, positive, encouraging and welcoming, and the staff that runs the place treats everyone with genuine excitement. I never thought I would feel at home in fitness environment but I look forward to going and I now go about 3 times a week. I have started seeing real results and weight loss and I know I couldn't have done it with out the people at Rise. If you only take one class here take it from Loui, his class is fun to take, the music is always on point and if you're lucky you might even get a bit of dance choreography from him on the stage :-)   That being said every trainer there will motivate and inspire you! Thank you Rise Nation!

text: I got a proper a** whuppin' in just 30 minutes. I loved (hated? but, in the best possible way) every second of it!  The music mix is great (and NOT too loud...I love music, but not when it's blowing my ear drums out), Alex the instructor kept me going, the studio design is GORGEOUS with a cool ceiling light show.  There's a gorgeous outdoor deck where you can cool down and sip on an organic cold-pressed juice from local native PALETA. Staff was attentive and super friendly.  I've had multiple surgeries on my neck/spine and this workout put zero pressure or impact on it. It's perfectly designed to keep your body aligned. No hunching over a spin bike that messes with your knees and spine. Can't wait to go back!  All hail Jason Walsh the owner!

text: I took my first class with Adam this morning and I will 100% be coming back. This class kicked my ass! Thank god it's only 30 minutes. The first 2 minutes I never thought I'd make it through the whole thing, but Adam was an amazing instructor and had me laughing the entire time and made me think less about the fact that I thought I was going to pass out. I really think this is one of the best workouts I've ever done in my life and I can easily say I have NEVER sweat that much. Thank you Adam for being an amazing instructor!!!!!

text: Rise Nation is awesome. It's as efficient of a workout as it gets. 30 hard minutes on a versa climber and you're out the door and feeling like you got a great workout. I LOVE KATIE! She's my favorite instructor! Definitely take her class. Not only is she adorable with such an amazing body (#fitspo), she goes out of her way to introduce herself to everyone in the class. She makes you feel so welcome and she's very encouraging and motivating during class. She is your biggest cheerleader. Plus, she plays such fun, up-beat music. She plays hip hop, pop, the works. She switches up the workout too. So each song she does a variety of moves on the climber that you didn't know you could do on that machine. Regarding the studio, the room itself is all black. They shut the lights off and pull the blinds down and have color-changing ceiling so it's almost like you're at a nightclub. That way you can workout without feeling insecure or that people are watching you. They have water for purchase or they have a machine you can refill your bottle with. They also provide a sweat towel at each machine. There's an outdoor patio too. Friendly staff! I highly recommend it.

text: I took Adam's Level A101 class Sunday morning for the first time. This is the longest 30 min of my life..hahaha but it's SUCH A GREAT work out. Adam is very high spirited and encouraging. It was a little intimidating going into class, looking at these machine that I've never seen before. But Adam was very helpful getting me situated in my machine. Although I read other people's review, was kind of expecting it to be hard, in the back of my mind was still..it's only 30 min. But...oh geez..it's so tiring..so hard..such long 30min! Music is great!! Stepping to the beat of the music definitely help me push through the class. It's a really really great work out. Will be coming back soon!

text: Wowie, this is a good workout. I've been here twice, with 2 years in between each visit (not really sure why I waited so long), and I've loved it each time. The benefit of this workout is it has a lot of punch packed into 30 minutes. You can get in and out and feel like you got a lot done. The class I recently went to was a free community class, which I happen to see on their email blast. Free workout? YES please! I told the staff I hadn't been there in 2 years, so I wanted to be treated as a newbie. They were so friendly. I think they might have the friendlies staff out of any fitness studio I've been to. They set me up on my machine, and after class told me how great I did, which was a good confidence booster. They have a big patio outside, good for cooling down after class. I do spin every week, but this class still made my thighs super tired and sore (which is great). Can't wait to go back.

text: I am obsessed with Rise Nation. It is the best cardio work out in town, in my opinion. But more importantly - the things it does for your ABS. Climbing on the machine requires you to use your low abs to lift your knees and my God, there's nothing I like more than my abs after Rise. Rise is intense but SO WORTH IT. Every time I go back I climb higher. Loui is my favorite instructor (also my first!) but I like all of them a lot. Nicolette's classes get my booty the most sore.

text: I took the noon class last Sunday at this climbing gym. Its was my first class with this instructor. Ive never had a worse class instructor in any specialized gym. When i take classes like this, my goal is to try to make the most of my class. But all she did was count. Which is fine but then half the class she was on her cell phone recording and i assume snap chatting her counting. I wasn't motivated at all and annoyed at her lack of focus. She didn't even tell us before hand that she will record. She just did it. I spoke to another class attendee and she also noticed the lack on concentration and it affected her performance as well. I won't be coming back to this gym. It was a disappointing experience. Planet Fitness might be more motivating

text: Came here for the A101 intro class on Sunday's with Adam and LOVED it!  Really glad they offer an introductory class on Sunday's cause this is a very challenging workout and by the end of the class I was still getting used to the Versaclimber, and yes, 30 minutes is PLENTY of time in these classes.  Staff was so helpful and friendly and Adam was such an amazing and motivating instructor making me laugh even though I wanted to die lol.  Bought the new student 3 for $30 after my class and can't wait to come back!  Was so sore the next day and truly is a great workout.  Only downside is paying for or finding parking.  The lot next door is $5 with validation, parking across the street is $3 with validation, or meter parking which I wasn't able to find on Sunday.

text: ADAM!!!! I'm going to put you in my pocket and take you everywhere!!! OMG, Rise Nation kicked my ass!!!! At first I thought, 30 minutes, no big deal. How much can you really work in 30 minutes?...Whomp. Two minutes in I looked at my friend saying, "dead! dying. done!" Could not even think about completing the rest of class. However, ADAM, our amazing instructor was the BEST THING EVER! I swear, if it was not for his awesome music and incredible energy, I wouldn't have made it through. It was a dance party up in here y'all!! Heeyyyyyyyy. Rise Nation was by far one of the hardest things I have ever done (and I teach fitness for a living), but I am totally addicted to it! Adam, you MADEEEE this class! The girls and I will be back just for you! Thank you for making torture fun!

text: I've now been to Rise Nation 3 times. It is a very nice, super clean studio, and the instructors are very friendly and motivating. I think people who like spinning would like this a lot. I'm not one of those people, so I'm not sure this is for me. The exercise is quite difficult while you're doing it, but I didn't feel any impact or exhaustion of muscles afterwards the way I would with running, Lagree method, or HIIT, my other go-to exercises. Maybe that is a good thing? I just don't know if I believe the "whole body workout" hype--to me, it just seemed like cardio. Then again, maybe I wasn't doing it right. In the end, for what feels like a cardio workout to me, I don't really like the repetitive, dark room scenario when we live in LA and could take it outside almost every day.

text: This place is no joke! I went in thinking this class would be a cinch since it's just 30 min. Boy was I wrong! Talk about a high intensity, FULL body workout! I had to stop a few times cause I couldn't keep up, but that only motivated me to get my butt into these classes on a regular basis so I can get my stamina up. Clean, hip, great music, kind staff, lots of parking. Machine is intimidating at first, but after a few minutes you'll get the hang of it, if not just ask for help from one of the kind staff members. Devin was my instructor and he is PERFECTION . I don't think I've ever seen such an incredible body on a man. If his body alone doesn't motivate you I don't know what will. Oh yeah, he's very sweet and helpful as well!

text: My arms and legs are feeling it after one session at Rise Nation.  I took a class with Adam and had a great experience.  The front desk staff and Adam were very welcoming and accommodating.  My climb machine was close to the front so I was a little intimidated at first, but once class started and the lights were off and the music was playing you don't pay attention to anyone else...just gotta focus on getting thru class without dying!  The workout is definitely very cardio-intensive.  You're moving your arms and legs simultaneously for the whole class, switching from short/long strides, rips/sprints, and changing the position of your arms on the machine. The good thing about Rise Nation is that class is only 30 mins!  I loved Adam's energy and his song choices were on point.  The music can be quite loud, but earplugs are available if needed.  Also towels and a water refilling station are provided.  So overall, Rise is a fun place to burn a ton of calories in a short amount of time.

text: If you want to sweat your butt off, this spot is for you. I've done two full marathons and after doing rise nation for the first time, it reminded me of completing a marathon! I was drenched like a mofo and felt good afterwards...ie..still on a cardio high and continuously sweating. I've had two different instructors, adam and another chick, but I prefer Adam. He's motivational and plays awesome music. The class is 30 minutes long, but seriously, that is all you need for this HIIT. They shut the blinds and dim the lights so you don't have to feel self-conscience if you're not keeping up with everyone. I love it and if it wasn't such a trek to get to WEHO, I would be there all the time. I tend to go early weekend mornings since parking is easy to find and metered parking is free...otherwise, they have a lot that charges $5. Summer is here...and summer body is near...so get your booty in shape with Rise Nation!

text: This studio truly lives up to it's hype! Adam Goldstein's class is without question my favorite, (as I take his classes at FlyWheel & remember the magical old days of Up Dog!) but all the staff here are awesome. It takes a couple classes to get used to, & even still if it's been a while since I've been in a class, one or both my feet will go numb simply because my body isn't up to par on cardio, but by my second consistent class I'm back in the "gimme more" flow! These workouts are intense, positive, exhausting (& then rejuvenating) & they tone my body like a mofo! Highly recommended!

text: I did The Climb through ClassPass today and I must say it completely kicked my butt. I am not the most fit person on the planet and I wanted to pretend to go to the bathroom about 8 minutes in so I could just leave and die in my car. But the instructor was very supportive and I felt like it was okay to break when I needed and go at my own pace at times. Many times. There was also a worker there before class who showed me the equipment and checked in on me afterwards.

text: Great little place to work out in a fast and efficient manner! The Versaclimber is a tough machine, but it doesn't feel so tough with lots of people working alongside you. If you have any joint issues, I'd start with some bracing or compression until you're sure you're OK, then reduce the support level as you feel more comfortable. I can't do really long cardio workouts and using most of your body at the same time ensures you work up a sweat quickly, for me, in the first minute. Because everyone is generally looking at their own readings and their own pace, I never worried about whether I was keeping up or not.  You do what you can do and challenge your last time and adherence to the patterns. No bad instructors here, and it looks like Russell and Britney are very positive, while Chenelle is quite passionate and will work you very hard in the Level 2 classes at WeHo. I bought a 20 class package to start, and will likely buy another 20. The classes are affordable and fun!

text: I didn't think 30 mins of exercise would be tough enough, and man was I wrong! This is an amazing workout. The instructors and music are really motivating (though you'll be really bummed if you don't like hip-hop). The studio is also really clean, and I love the way it's lit. I'm only docking a star because even though you choose your machine, the clientele seems to think that those assignments are suggestions. More than once, I've had to search for a free machine, which sucks.

text: Took my first class here last week because I wanted to get a workout in and didn't have a lot of time... the classes are only 30 minutes long, but they are no joke - they work your entire body and are still jam packed with the intensity of an hour long workout. I was dripping sweat by the end of class. The studio was so cool! The ceiling reminded me of a neon mountain range and makes for a motivating setting to climb in, plus they have a pretty, zen rooftop patio with a juice bar to chill out in post-workout. Nicollette Roux was my instructor and she was fabulous, she helped me get set up as a first timer and kept up the energy throughout the whole class. I will definitely be back.

text: Rise Nation utilizes only versaclimbers, an incredibly effective piece of cardio equipment, which creates an all-body high intensity workout. The classes are very much like a spinning class but it will burn more calories, in less time.  Since the classes are only 30 minutes it is more difficult to rationalize a "skip the gym" day because you are short on time.  However, the real GEM of Rise Nation that sets is apart is that the space has the ambiance of a high-end dance club, incredible EDM soundtracks and amazingly hot instructors -- all of them!

text: I took my very first class, Level 2 with Jason over the weekend. I consider myself an active person and have lost approx 25 pounds. I'm usually taking indoor cycling and other forms of exercise classes on a regular basis and when I saw this course was only 30 minutes, I thought to myself "it shouldn't be that bad. Let me give it a try." OMG was I wrong. After 10 minutes, my body was already warmed up and sweating heavily. This is by far the best exercise class ever taken. You will work every part of your body! I'm addicted. Do not get intimidated and give this a try. You will not regret it. Worth every penny without a doubt. :) #StayStrong #RiseNation

text: They had tried to sell me on a package to pay more for first time customers, leaving out that the classes would expire after a month. So I basically payed $40 for one class. Mind you, we got there a little late and he said it's fine, which I thought had meant the class hasn't started yet (but the class was already ten min in so really only got a 20 min workout for $40) I had initially only wanted to buy one drop in class but he insisted that it's a better deal to buy 4 for 40. So when I went to go book another class it said I didn't have any left. If something has an expiration date on it that should be clear and the customers should be informed. When I called to ask about it the lady on the phone had nothing to say other than "sorry about that." If I had known it expires after a month, I wouldn't have bought it simply because I don't live in the area. I hate when people try to up-sell you on something and leave details out. very unprofessional and for that I will no longer be going back. Definitely an establishment that is more focused on your money instead of the customer.

text: Super intense 30-minute workout. Very friendly instructor and staff who came around at the beginning of the Intro class to make sure that any newbies were set up correctly on the machines and had the correct form. High intensity / loud music / dim lighting. But loved that the instructor was encouraging of breaks and provided the right amount of motivation without being like a drill sergeant. I kept having to take breaks from hand and foot cramping - the machine is unlike anything I've worked out on before. But I was definitely sore the next day! Recommend removing any rings from your hands for the workout.

text: Was lucky enough to take the intro level 1 class thru class pass! The facilities are so clean and gorgeous and the front desk is welcoming and not pushy about joining. They let you know the specials after class but that's about it. As for the class...there's a filtered water fountain to fill your bottle with it and trust me you'll need it. It's only 30 minutes but it kicks your butt. The Versa Climber is easy to use and comfortable on your joints but don't fight it, once you find your groove it's awesome. Chandler was an awesome instructor for the class and took you thru all the basic moves perfectly! Her song mix was awesome. Once the class starts they lower the black out blinds and the fun begins because the whole jagged rock climbingesque ceiling lights up with the most incredible distracting light show to take your mind off how intense the work out is. It was literally the coolest most awesome cardio I've ever done and when I was done I felt like my joints weren't worn but that I had really worked every muscle group and couldn't wait to do it again. The next morning I felt sore but in a great way. Rise nation is amazing and you gotta give it a shot!

about:
The Workouts:

Introducing Pound!: Pound is a full-body cardio jam session, combining light resistance with constant simulated drumming. The workout fuses cardio, Pilates, isometric movements, plyometrics and Isometric poses into a 45-minute series. Burn between 600 and 900 calories per hour, strengthen and sculpt infrequently used muscles, and drum your way to a leaner, slimmer physique - all while rocking out to your favorite music!

Endurance Pilates:  55 minute group class on customized Pilates Reformers. Strength and endurance training, core and stability activation, full body workout. It burns, tones and promotes lean long muscles.

The Mashup:  25 minutes of Cardio Intervals on treadmills. Raises your heart rate, taxes your cardio-vascular system, gets you real sweaty and burns calories. Then hop on our customized Reformers for 30 minutes of Endurance Pilates.       *Options for Beginners, Intermediate and Advanced runners
text: Fitmix is the best pilates studio I have ever been to. I love all the instructors. Even though the classes are group classes, each instructor gives you personal attention when needed and they are more than helpful when you have any questions. I can't say enough good things about this studio. I think most people who go there can agree because classes fill up so quickly and you need to sign up almost a week or more in advance.

text: The best! I've only taken one class here, but I've taken a bunch of Pilates classes in LA, and so far their Endurance Pilates class is my favorite - by FAR. Great music, knowledgable trainers, class pushes you to your limits without pushing too far. I box a ton and thought I was in great shape - but this class made me sore in such good ways! Great workout, one of the owners, Diana, is one of the most wonderful humans I know.

text: Being a guy, I wasn't sure if this was going to be for me.  I thought pilates was a low intensity, easy workout aimed at women.  WRONG!  I ended up getting a much better workout from their amazing trainers than I ever got by myself at the gym.  The first class was free, but I felt like I should have paid for it since I got so much personal attention from the trainer who was consistently adjusting my form and making sure everyone was getting the most from their workout.  I of course immediately signed up for a package of classes and every class has been an amazing workout.  I didn't realize you could get in such great shape from this kind of exercise!

text: I discovered this place through a Groupon. I tried a few of the different classes and two different instructors.  Depends on the teacher, your physical limitations, their knowledge of modifications and injuries and how they work with you for one to really enjoy it and the get most out of it. One trainer somehow felt that if you weren't working like you were on the Biggest Loser, you weren't getting ANY benefits. I did fast walking on the treadmill and compensated by going more uphill and felt sweaty and heart racing. That wasn't enough for him. As we know from any physical therapist or trainer, or health practitioner, any amount of walking (30min a day) will even be of benefit. The second trainer was awesome and worked with my limitations. She was much younger than I, and even she admitted to "blowing out my hip" from all of her running. At my age (over 45) and with my sports injuries, the last thing I'd want to do is injure myself further. They key word is "push you to YOUR limit," but YOU have to know YOUR body!"

text: I love Fitmix Studio!  The classes are so fun because of Diana and Brian's energy and the great music they play!  I have always felt really awkward in group classes and immediately both Diana and Brian made me feel comfortable and welcome. There are nine people in each class, but everyone gets very personalized help to make sure the exercises are done correctly. I have a weak lower back from an old injury and they are both very careful to help me adjust exercises if necessary.  They never make you feel bad about yourself and yet they find the perfect way to push you each class and you leave feeling like you had a great workout!

text: I was in town for the holidays and looking for a great place to workout at.  I found Fitmix Studio on ClassPass and decided to give it a try.  I took the Mashup class with Mandalyn and absolutely loved it!  I workout regularly and would say I'm in shape but this class definitely challenged me.  I loved that I was able to get my cardio in with the 30 minutes of treadmill intervals and then tone and strengthen on the pilates reformer afterwards.  The reformer workout was definitely much harder after the half hour workout on the treadmill.  Mandalyn was such a friendly and motivating instructor.  She was great about giving instructions and tips while we were running and while we were on the reformer.  Her music was also great and helped encourage us through the difficult workout.  There is no workout like this in Northern California where I live.  I wish they opened one there...I would definitely make it my regular workout!  The studio was clean and spacious.  I went on a weekend and there were plenty of street parking nearby.

text: I went to the 6:00 a.m. Mashup class this morning and LOVED it! What a great way to kick start my dar! I had the pleasure of being instructed by Diana, and having Brian in the class! I was sweating within the first 2 minutes of class, and left with a great workout high and sore body parts!

text: I am in love and it shows! Fitmix is one of the most awesome studios of any kind I have ever worked out in. The small classes give you the personalized attention we all crave, however the high ceilings, ventilation, and spaciousness of the studio help to avoid feeling like you are working out on top of your neighbor. Diana and Brian are AMAZING! Their varying styles allow me to set my pilates schedule just right so I get just enough burn for my butt (oops I meant "burn for my buck" but the other works too)... Diana is known for throwing out an enthusiastic "Yeah" every so often which lets you know that she hasn't forgotten about you and she's watching that stopwatch. Brian will often break into a soul clap which helps to take your mind off that shaking in your thigh and that burn in your backside. Sarah's "fist pounds all around"  is one of the most supportive rewards one could hope for (next to a double portion of chocolate lava cake) after a conquering her "rolling hills" during Mashup. I am so pleased with how my mind and body have changed since stepping into Fitmix. The Fitmix squad took someone who wasn't runner and hadn't done pilates in 3 years and turned her into a running, breathing, pulsing, holding, burning, holding, focusing, holding, releasing, resisting, pushing, maniac! The teachers are great, the studio is clean, the parking is plentiful, the tunes are fantastic, and the burn is SO good you almost can't move afterwards but come morning your body is begging for more. What more could you possibly ask for in a studio???

text: I am a workout snob and have been to every pilates studio in the area- WeHo, Brentwood, SM, Hollywood, BH- and this is by far the best pilates studio there is. DEFINITELY go. No hesitation

text: I love this place.  I live across the street, so that's why I decided to give them a try- it's been several months now and I'm mad I didn't try them sooner.  I used to go to my other pilates place once a week because it was a good workout but felt like work,  at Fitmix I decided to up it to 2-3 times because not only is it a good workout, but they make it fun too.  The instructors (I haven't had a bad one, and I think I've tried almost all) are all super upbeat, positive and mindful of the students- if they see you doing something wrong or struggling, they'll come help you (they'll also tell you if you are doing something right - so that's really encouraging).  I've definitely become stronger and I think more balanced mentally as this place has turned into my happy escape.

text: Amazing, amazing, amazing!..need I go on? On my quest to get in shape for the summer I stumbled across Fitmix Studio in West Hollywood & boy am I glad I did!! From the moment I first walked into the studio I felt at home. The space is very inviting and both Diana and Brian are super friendly, attentive, and down to earth. Previous to attending the studio, I had been taking pilates at another studio in Studio City but Fitmix really makes you break a sweat! The first pilates class I took was with Diana and I could definetely feel the burn. The second class I took was with Brian and let me tell you, that was definetely a "I just got my ass kicked in pilates class" experience! Wow!!! He makes sure you work hard and to your full potential & he keeps a very close eye on you so you don't slack off!!! Not to mention, he was constantly correcting my form making sure I was doinng each move precicely and effectively! So far I've attended three classes so far and I feel myself getting stronger and fitter day by day...I luv this place!

text: Finally found it! I have been to a handful of pilates studios in Los Angeles and this by FAR my favorite. This workout is no joke!! The space is big, open and clean and the energy is so welcoming. Diana and Brian are such amazing teachers. They have very different styles so it is fun to switch it up every once in awhile. They have recently added a few new trainers that I haven't tried but I hear they are also great. They push you as far as you can go without that drill sergent thing you find at so many other places. The MASHUP....brilliant. Enough said.

text: Went yesterday for the first time through Class Pass, and wow, the treadmill intervals kicked my butt!  Before starting Class Pass, I was a regular runner, but I had to occasionally walk during the recovery periods and take the lowest suggested pace for the hills and sprints.  Even the pilates was tough -- great arm work!  I don't get sore often, since I'm used to working my muscles pretty regularly, but I can feel a little bit in my arms today.  Great workout, and I'll definitely be back!

text: ***update: finally got a class. Someone emailed me from there and informed me that some classes were open, so I was luckily free and slipped into an 8:30pm class. It was definitely an intense workout. Especially, if you're not used to doing pilates on a regular basis. At one point, I kind of collapsed in laughter because I had maxed out on these push up to elbow planks we were doing 3/4 of the way into the class. I think the rest of the ladies in the class were doing a lot better than me, which just goes to show that you can get a lot stronger. I'd really like to go again since it's in the neighborhood. I just can't figure out how I'm going to afford it as a student. Even the student price is steep when you don't have a job. So, I have to give 3 stars for now because I like it, but it's unattainable for me. :(

text: Whoa. I took a Mashup class and learned that I have been running on the treadmill all wrong, as this workout made me super-sweaty. The treadmill portion consisted of intervals of 2 minute intense runs (some on verrrrry steep inclines) and 2 minute recovery periods. The rest of the class is on the pilates reformer, which made my abs so sore the next day. I will be back, Fitmix!

text: Holy cow! What a workout! The mash-up is INTENSE! The combo of cardio and pilates is genius. Both Diana and Brian are GREAT! Brian was so encouraging throughout the whole workout (I haven't worked out in about 6 months...so I was in horrible shape and decided to kick start getting back in shape with the mash-up....I looked like such a fail haha). They both are super helpful showing you the correct posture or technique. I really felt comfortable going at my own pace. The music helps a ton and so does the fan ON the treadmill! I don't think I would be able to finish the treadmill without that fan haha.

text: I took the "Mash Up" class on their opening day which just happened to be on Easter.  Diana taught the class and she took no prisoners on the treadmill.  We started off on the treadmill for about 25 min moving through a nice warm up into an intense cardio session.  Diana did a great job with giving speed options on the treadmills for all levels and her personality and music choice made time fly by.  After the tread session of the workout we then moved to the pilates machines.  Doing Pilates after the treadmill was a whole new experience for me, so much more challenging.  I have done pilates in the past and thought it was a bit boring and not very challenging.  This class was far from boring and was extremely challenging.

I definitely recommend his class.

text: The Mashup is, hands down, one of the best workout classes I have ever tried! I will definitely be back! The workout starts with 30 minutes of intervals on the treadmill that focus on sprints, hills, and endurance. There are a variety of options in terms of speed for beginner, intermediate, and advanced runners. I never felt pressured or forced to push myself-- instead, I found myself inspired and motivated to push myself!!

text: I really love this studio and I didn't think I would!  I've been doing pilates for a long time.  I initially learned classical and grew to love a more West Coast style but haven't been that interested in the more exercise-based (less therapeutic) styles of pilates.  Their pilates classes have changed my opinion.  Definitely more of a work out, which is great, depending on your exercise goals for that day.  The classes are challenging but very safe.  I have an injury and the teachers are always careful to monitor my form so I don't re-injur the area.  The pilates classes involve thoughtful and interesting sequencing.  Definitely recommend the studio!

text: What a great and fun workout !! Definitely a step up from plain pilates. Want to make some changes in your body and mind? Then give this studio a try.  Combining pilates with intervals on the treadmill is an invigorating and challenging workout.  But the positive energy in this studio makes a challenging workout feel like a day at the spa.

text: I love working out here!  I have been coming to Fitmix for about 2 months and I'm seeing changes in my body and feeling leaner every week. I do the Mashup about 1 - 2x per week and 2x Endurance Pilates classes and wow, do I break a sweat every time. It is very challenging but they take time to correct your form and there are options for all fitness levels. The instructors are great, the studio is clean and airy and bright, and patrons have a great vibe. I agree with Jennifer S. -- Fitmix is the best pilates experience I have had, hands down, anywhere. I live nearby so I ride my bike there so I don't have to deal with parklng, which can be limited in the mornings and street cleaning days. My tip-- ride a bike to class and use their bike rack inside. Take advantage of the Student Discount if you are in school, and don't forget to bring a towel to class. You will get sweaty but you will leave euphoric. Addictive!

text: I love this studio. The space is clean, open and inviting. Both Brian and Diana teach diverse and challenging classes with encouraging attitudes. Diana was the first pilates instructor I ever had back in 2010 when she was teaching at Pilates Plus (now Pilates Platinum) and of all the instructors I've taken classes with since, she remains my favorite. She is attentive, has great energy, and is totally accommodating when it comes to offering modifications if you're a beginner or working with an injury.

The studio is clean and spacious, and the instructors are always really friendly and helpful. Don't worry if you can't handle the workout at top-speed/performance; you can adjust the workout to suit your level of fitness.

text: I love, love, love this place. If I could give them 10 stars I would. I don't know what has taken me so long to write this review, but it is long overdue. The 2 types of classes that are offered are both challenging, fun, and fast. It's the best workout you can get in an hour. The Mash up is HARD, but it makes you feel so good when you have finished it! Cardio and strength training all in one. Pilates gets your ripped, but with long lean muscles. Aside from having challenging workouts, the instructors are the BEST. Diana and Brian have built the most fun, challenging, and encouraging work out environment in LA, I'm sure of it.

text: Can I just say how awesomely intense the Pound classes are and how much I love them. They work every bit of your body and probably is one of the best BUTT workouts I've ever done besides Pilates. Sammie is my instructor for the 8:30pm class on Tuesdays and she's so great! She does the workouts with you and makes sure everyone is having a fun time. Such a creative workout with pleasing results. Not to mention the first class is free and every class after that is only $10. ;)  Love me some FITMIX!

text: One of THE best places to get a good workout in LA! Diana and Brian are incredible teachers and I can't wait to try out the rest of their staff. The Mash-up classes are the best because you get about 25 minutes of HIIT cardio in before they kick your ass on the pilates reformer. If you have any muscle that you try to avoid using when you go to the gym -- be prepared to have that muscle used here. You cannot hide from your weak spots here!

text: This place is fantastic! I've been to the Mashup twice now. I consider myself a runner, but this really pushed my limits (in such a good way!). I've never run so fast on an incline before, and I  was shocked that I was able to do it. The Pilates portion also was great--I really appreciated the corrections to my form that made the moves focus on the right parts of my body and feel that much harder. Diana is a fabulous instructor! She really knows what she's doing and will make you smile the whole time (even when you are giving her a death stare in the mirror as she pushes you to not give up).

text: I would give this place more than 5 stars if I could! I tried many pilates but never felt in love with it until I tried FitMix thanks to ClassPass! I truly love this workout it is by far the most intense I have done, I get sore for the next 48 hours after each workout with Mike, he is extremely challenging and plays good music! The space has very high ceiling and strong fans which is very pleasant too! I tried both endurance and mashup classes. Mashup is very intense and you sweat a lot during the 1st 30 min on the treadmill, then 30 minutes of Pilates. To me endurance works better because I am not a big fan of treadmill workout but a lot of people might like the combination of the cardio/pilate in the same class.

text: Love this gym!  You're in and out in an hour and you feel like you really worked out and burned calories! The staff and trainers are amazing!

text: I just finished my second class here and I'm hooked.  In the past 3 years I've had two kids and have been sort of chained to them without much me time.  (We lived out of state with no family nearby.)  Now that we live back in LA, with family and friends around, I am starting to venture out a bit here and there sans kids.  Hooray!  :D  And now that I'm DONE having kids I decided I need to get serious about getting in shape.  I considered many different types of classes - bar method, pop physique, a regular gym, swimming - and decided to go with Fitmix because of all the rave reviews.

text: The best one hour workout in LA! Love this studio! The staff is incredible! You can't go wrong, try a class you won't regret it :)

about: Welcome to Orangetheory Fitness, the energizing group interval fitness concept that is sweeping the nation! Orangetheory Fitness is a one-of-a-kind workout broken into intervals of cardiovascular and strength training, using a variety of equipment including treadmills, rowing, TRX straps, and free weights to tone your body and gain energy throughout the day.
text: I love this place. Great place filled with positivity and great people. Staff is very helpful and attentive. Gym is always clean, organized and all equipment and weights are always in top working condition. You do get what you pay for here and more! Im still new to the scene but Emily helped me get acquainted with the whole program rather quickly with her superior customer service. Come in, do work and leave. Its as simple as that. Also Drew plays all the dope hip hop so be sure to drop in on his classes. Thanks OT Weho :)

about: Welcome to Orangetheory Fitness, the energizing group interval fitness concept that is sweeping the nation! Orangetheory Fitness is a one-of-a-kind workout broken into intervals of cardiovascular and strength training, using a variety of equipment including treadmills, rowing, TRX straps, and free weights to tone your body and gain energy throughout the day.
text: I'm obsessed! Wish I started class sooner. Can't wait to see the results from coming constantly.

about: Welcome to Orangetheory Fitness, the energizing group interval fitness concept that is sweeping the nation! Orangetheory Fitness is a one-of-a-kind workout broken into intervals of cardiovascular and strength training, using a variety of equipment including treadmills, rowing, TRX straps, and free weights to tone your body and gain energy throughout the day.
text: I joined Orange Theory Fitness 14 months ago and I am in the best shape of my life and I owe it all to OTF.  The whole workout is based on exercise science and physiology. Generally, I workout there 4-5 times a week but sometimes only 2 or 3 times so I know that it is a great workout for getting stronger, fitter, losing weight (if that is a goal of yours) and maintaining.  Jessica, Mikey, Erin, and Drew are my usual coaches and they are all great regarding knowledge of the body and correct execution of the exercises. They are there to coach, support, motivate and teach and they are all experts at what they do. They are also available after classes if you have specific questions. Jess and her ab blasts at the end are the bomb. She really cares about my performance and will push me, if I need it. Her enthusiasm for coaching shines through and I will say the same about Drew, Erin and Mikey. I have learned so much about proper positioning and form from Mikey. He is a perfectionist when it comes to demonstrating and coaching. Drew is great at checking to make sure that you are performing the exercises correctly and he is so positive and upbeat and knowledgable.

about: Welcome to Orangetheory Fitness, the energizing group interval fitness concept that is sweeping the nation! Orangetheory Fitness is a one-of-a-kind workout broken into intervals of cardiovascular and strength training, using a variety of equipment including treadmills, rowing, TRX straps, and free weights to tone your body and gain energy throughout the day.
text: By far my favorite place to work out. Every single staff member here is incredibly kind and professional, which makes for a very welcoming experience. Some of my favorite trainers include Phil, Drew, Whitney and Mike.

about: Welcome to Orangetheory Fitness, the energizing group interval fitness concept that is sweeping the nation! Orangetheory Fitness is a one-of-a-kind workout broken into intervals of cardiovascular and strength training, using a variety of equipment including treadmills, rowing, TRX straps, and free weights to tone your body and gain energy throughout the day.
text: BOOYA!! This is the place to go! Community, fitness, aliveness in ACTION. I love OTF WeHo. My second home. I just moved back to LA after 7 years of living on the East Coast and I was so happy to discover Josh and the OTF team! They make me feel like a star and most importantly a friend. Just do it! You won't regret!

about: Welcome to Orangetheory Fitness, the energizing group interval fitness concept that is sweeping the nation! Orangetheory Fitness is a one-of-a-kind workout broken into intervals of cardiovascular and strength training, using a variety of equipment including treadmills, rowing, TRX straps, and free weights to tone your body and gain energy throughout the day.
text: I have been a member at Orange Theory for over a year, and I still leave every single workout, exhausted, dripping in sweat, and sore the next day! The coaches here are awesome, and always do a great job keeping me motivated throughout the entire workout.  If your looking for some great old school rap, or music that will get you pumped the entire time, check out one of Drew's classes.  Also, parking is never a problem, and there is a huge parking structure they validate for.  Huge plus for West Hollywood!

text: Love the studio , workouts, and the coaches here! It's convenient to my house and there are other locations to visit when I travel, continuing the lifestyle !

The Mashup:  25 minutes of Cardio Intervals on treadmills. Raises your heart rate, taxes your cardio-vascular system, gets you real sweaty and burns calories. Then hop on our customized Reformers for 30 minutes of Endurance Pilates.       *Options for Beginners, Intermediate and Advanced runners
text: I loved the Mashup class with Diana! I've been eyeing this studio on ClassPass for quite a while, but was intimidated by the running component. I enjoy running outside, but testing my skills on a treadmill alongside "runners" sounded terrifying. But I'm so glad I finally worked up the nerve!

text: Just finished my first workout at OTF and very big fan! I'd describe my fitness level as- can't remember the last time I did anything cardio, but could probably tough things out. Hour long workouts, stays interesting because you're constantly changing stations, I like the water row machines, and nice big screens that show you heart rate percentage and "zone". So you kind of feel accomplished because you get points :) Also easy to tailor to your fitness level.

text: I've been working out for more than 20 years and tried every workout imaginable ... this one is the best. It's not just a workout ... it's a family. I know that sounds weird but once you go you will understand what I mean :) I love my OrangeTheory family and I love what OrangeTheory has done to my body!!! Best part ... the workout is NEVER the same. ALL fitness levels welcome and this really is for everyone ... whether you've been working out for one week, one year, or decades like me.

text: This is the only workout that I have actually stuck with and noticed results!  The workouts will never be the same and they keep it very fun and sometimes competitive. When I first started i was running a 10 minute mile and now I am down to 6 minutes!  They have peak performance week several times a year and it allows you to see how much you have improved. I definitly recommend this place.

text: I've never loved going to a gym before, and I have been SO happy going to OT! It's been almost a year, I'm down 20 lbs, and I'm not dying if I decide to go to hike runyon on the weekend.

about: Welcome to Orangetheory Fitness, the energizing group interval fitness concept that is sweeping the nation! Orangetheory Fitness is a one-of-a-kind workout broken into intervals of cardiovascular and strength training, using a variety of equipment including treadmills, rowing, TRX straps, and free weights to tone your body and gain energy throughout the day.
text: I began doing OT over a year ago and can honestly say it is my favorite workout. I used to do ClassPass, but recently decided to cut that out completely and just focus on my OT workouts, hiking and maybe a yoga class or two thrown in there. OT focuses on HIIT with a heart rate monitor so that you can determine whether you are in the "orange" fat-burning zone. This is a great way to gage whether you have more gas in the tank. In comparison to other HIIT workouts, OT is by far the best. The trainers are extremely motivating, kind, and make it easy for people of varying levels to do the workout without feeling overwhelmed.

text: Out of all the OTFs I've been to this one has been my favorite.  Super personable staff, great customer service, great workout!  The staff went above and beyond to send me a text before class and give me a follow up call.  The trainer, Richie (I think was his name), was great.  The whole experience very positive!

text: Wow! What can I say. I went onto their website, it states you can sign up for a free 1 hour session. I signed up, at the West Hollywood location. Amber, a representative from the club reached out and mentioned that it would be $12 for an hour. I responded with screenshots of the website, and told her that her club was not a club that had an asterisk next to it, and that only clubs with an asterisk, as noted on the site, are clubs that you have to pay for the 1 hour introductory training. When you scroll to the bottom of the website, it clearly states this! She went on to say that I was confused! I sent her a screenshot, to show her an example, i.e. Brentwood vs. West Hollywood, and still was told that the corporate site was wrong, I got hit with the good luck on your training endeavors email. Really! Bad marketing, and poor customer service at it's best! I will be forwarding this email to the corporate office.

Amber walked me through all the machines and gave me a tour of the beautiful space before the class began. I felt so welcomed from the second I walked in. They have beautiful showers available and lots of other little things such as hair ties (it's the little things that make a big difference). The workout itself was an hour and I loved how it was the right mix of cardio and strength training.. The hour flew by and I left feeling energized and a little sore (which is great). Lastly, a couple of the regular goers were so sweet and welcomed me to the club...it's a great environment to be a part of. Also...they validate parking. Love this place so much!

about: Welcome to Orangetheory Fitness, the energizing group interval fitness concept that is sweeping the nation! Orangetheory Fitness is a one-of-a-kind workout broken into intervals of cardiovascular and strength training, using a variety of equipment including treadmills, rowing, TRX straps, and free weights to tone your body and gain energy throughout the day.
text: OTF is amazing! I've been a member since October 2015. It's the first time I've gotten motivated enough to work out regularly. Most of the trainers make an effort to know your name and will NOT let you slack. You're essentially getting a personal trainer for much much cheaper because if part of the workout is too hard for you or you have an injury you can ask them to alter the movements for you which  is amazing.

about: Welcome to Orangetheory Fitness, the energizing group interval fitness concept that is sweeping the nation! text: Not for the weak! If you're seriously wanting a transformed body join OTF West Hollywood! This is a serious workout and results are fast!!

about: Welcome to Orangetheory Fitness, the energizing group interval fitness concept that is sweeping the nation! Orangetheory Fitness is a one-of-a-kind workout broken into intervals of cardiovascular and strength training, using a variety of equipment including treadmills, rowing, TRX straps, and free weights to tone your body and gain energy throughout the day.
text: If you're looking for a mediocre workout to while your children are with the nanny, this studio is NOT for you! Be advised: This is not a "boot camp". Trainers aren't screaming in your face or forcing you to do actives outside your comfort zone.  However, if you take part in all the classes offered; and push yourself, you will undoubtedly see a difference in your fitness level, stamina and more importantly your waist line. Orange Theory is designed to help the dedicated achieve their fitness goals.

about: Welcome to Orangetheory Fitness, the energizing group interval fitness concept that is sweeping the nation! Orangetheory Fitness is a one-of-a-kind workout broken into intervals of cardiovascular and strength training, using a variety of equipment including treadmills, rowing, TRX straps, and free weights to tone your body and gain energy throughout the day.
text: I have been to quite a few Orangetheory facilities and have found one thing to be very consistent.... the staff is happy to work there. West Hollywood is no different. From when you walk in, to sweating your booty off and then walking out the door. Brendan, Delvon and Drew are incredible trainers. They always know when to motivate when you're on the brink of falling apart. Josh and Dylan are hilarious and very accommodating when it comes to the business side. Tamara and Haley are super sweet and a pleasure to see early in the mornings.

about: Welcome to Orangetheory Fitness, the energizing group interval fitness concept that is sweeping the nation! Orangetheory Fitness is a one-of-a-kind workout broken into intervals of cardiovascular and strength training, using a variety of equipment including treadmills, rowing, TRX straps, and free weights to tone your body and gain energy throughout the day.
text: Amazing you must try this spot...great way to push your own limits and have a great time doing it...

about: Welcome to Orangetheory Fitness, the energizing group interval fitness concept that is sweeping the nation! Orangetheory Fitness is a one-of-a-kind workout broken into intervals of cardiovascular and strength training, using a variety of equipment including treadmills, rowing, TRX straps, and free weights to tone your body and gain energy throughout the day.
text: I love, love, love Orangetheory Fitness. I cannot say enough about it. I was referred by a friend originally, and in-turn I have also referred friends. The workout is done at your own level/ability, and you burn 500 calories or more every time. The heart monitor lets you know exactly where you are in your body so that you can maintain, increase, or even decrease intensity. And the 'orange theory' aspect of it is kind of like a game: you watch yourself on the screens mounted on the studio walls so that you know in real-time how you are doing. I also love that they have a couple of showers, too, so that you can clean-up afterward (I used the shower on several occasions and am happy to report it was clean, comfortable, and roomy -- don't worry if you forget a towel, they have them).

text: I started at the end of November rehabilitating a bum knee and was in the worst shape of my life. I was doubtful that this place could do anything more than kickstart my trek back to recovery. I planned on doing a month maybe two and then going somewhere else.

text: I've been at this studio for 3 and a half years, and still going strong. Orangetheory is truly the best group fitness class around. The workouts are tough and varied, which makes it fun. Just try a class or two and you'll love it as much as everyone else. WeHo has great staff and coaches, and a big variety of members. Can't say enough good things!

text: WeHo OTF has super friendly and attentive staff and coaches! Gym is always clean and it's easy to sign up for classes through their app. OTF makes working out enjoyable for those who struggle to get themselves to the gym on their own!

text: It's a vigorous but fun workout and definitely worth the money. The staff at all of the locations I've been to is extremely polite, friendly and encouraging, the studio atmosphere is upbeat, very clean, always easy parking, lockers and showers available.

text: Ive been an unlimited member for a few months now and I have to say I love it!! I had been on classpass for a year but got tired of looking for cardio classes.  I tried a intro class and was hooked.  It's a different workout every time and you sweat like no other cardio I've tried including barrys and risenation which may come close.  The instructors are all motivating and encourage you to do your best.  The parking is seamless and validated for 90 minutes so there are never any hidden parking charges.  The studio itself is always clean and plenty of lockers for personals.  It is best to book a class because they are usually full so walkins are not a good idea.  Sweat on!

text: Orange Theory Melrose is my happy place! Erin and Eric are amazing trainers and the sense of community is really special. This is a fantastic place to get a quality workout in whether you are an elite athlete or total newcomer. I'm super type-A, so being able to track my progress in real time with the heart rate monitor keeps me motivated during the workout and competing with myself to beat my scores keeps me coming back!

text: I have been working out at Orangetheory Fitness in West Hollywood since May 2017, and it's been my favorite ever since then. The workouts are amazing and it pushes me hard. Trainers are wonderful ( Richard, Mikey are my favorite ) , everyone working here is nice and helpful. You guys know i'd give 10 stars if i could so i will give it a 5 star rating since that's all i can give. Highly recommended studio. Thank you for all that you do.

text: First of all - the Orangetheory Fitness program is the way to go for weight loss and overall getting in shape. I am a collegiate athlete and am usually not challenged by group workouts but this is very challenging.

about: Welcome to Orangetheory Fitness, the energizing group interval fitness concept that is sweeping the nation! Orangetheory Fitness is a one-of-a-kind workout broken into intervals of cardiovascular and strength training, using a variety of equipment including treadmills, rowing, TRX straps, and free weights to tone your body and gain energy throughout the day.
text: This studio is so so amazing! I joined in November to get the left over baby weight off-and within 3 months of going consistently I am back down to pre baby weight-plus a lot stronger and fitter then I was even before my pregnancy. I would be ripped by now if I just stopped eating so much pasta and rice haha-but seriously haven't changed my diet at all-it's all from the work outs. The workouts are different every day so it never gets boring-and they are always challenging so you don't plateau. Every single coach is great but my personal favorites are Benzo and Halima-they both somehow make you feel like you're getting personally trained in a group. The front desk staff are all super sweet and helpful.   The equipment is all new and the place is kept spotless unlike so many gyms in Hollywood. My husband was so amazed at my quick transformation that he joined in January-and he has always been a die hard gym guy who hated group classes (weight lifting etc). It's not cheap but 1000% worth it. I am so happy I joined. Highly recommend to anyone.

text: I have been going to orange theory for the last couple months and it has completely changed my mind and body. It is a lifestyle change that will significantly better you. Coach Halima is incredible and will work with you to reach goals you didn't think were possible. I highly recommend joining! It will be the best decision you make.

text: One of the best workouts you can find! If you want to lose weight, tone, or just get a good sweat this is seriously a place to try.

text: I'll start by saying I hate gyms. I'm already fairly fit, but I just can't motivate to go to a gym and it's hard to get a full workout in an hour. I tried a free OTF class and signed up immediately after, and now spend more $ than I imagined spending at a gym, but it's because it motivates me to go and I get a tremendous workout guaranteed inside an hr. Most of my classes have been with Mike and Drew, but I've had classes with about every trainer and they're all incredible. If you're unsure, just try it!

about:
HIIT House LA is a 50 minute HIIT (high intensity interval training) program.

Each class is separated into 3 circuits of 3 Exercises (performed for a minute each), that you will complete 3 times. Why repeat the same exercise 3 times?  It often takes a minute to truly master proper form.
We want you safe and working efficiently! So, first round of the circuit is all about getting the form down, second is about about getting stronger and the third time through is about crushing the exercises.
The workouts are presented in two flavors:

BUILD: 

Whether your goal is hypertrophy (gaining muscle mass) or long and lean muscles, this is the class for you!  You will be put through 3 circuits of 3 exercises 3 times!
This means you get 3 touches on each exercise to truly master the lift  and exhaust the muscle group.  This translates to big gains!

SHRED: 

The name says it all.  This total body class is High-intensity interval training (HIIT) at it's best!  You will be put through intervals of high-intensity exercise followed by low intensity exercises.
These workout are designed to burn the fat away!  Come get shredded!

Each class ends with abs and stretching

I know, I know! In a world of 35 minute workouts, why is our workout sooooo long?  I'm glad you asked!  We include a warm-up, HIIT workout, abs, annnnnnd stretching.
text: Very welcoming environment for all levels of fitness! Trainers are attentive and supportive. Been going here for a few months and have already seen great results, leading to me making HIIT House LA part of my daily routine. Highly recommend!

text: I have never been a person who can force myself to lift weights at a gym until I found HIIT House. Now, I am a committed, 6 days a week gym-goer! Its the atmosphere and the trainers that truly make this gym completely different than anywhere else. All the trainers know your name and actually work with you to make sure you are getting the most out of your workout. They are so kind and motivational it makes coming to the class an experience I look forward to. It also seems like the only gym in LA that is a judgement free zone. Everyone is there to workout and encourage others. I cannot say enough positive things about HIIT House; coming here has changed my body, my endurance and my view of weight training forever!

text: I joined ClassPass in June of 2018, looking to get back into a steady fitness routine after over a year without a gym membership and only running / at-home body-weight circuits. After trying a few different classes around Beverly Hills and West Hollywood, I stumbled upon HIIT House - not the first gym of its ilk to cross my radar, but certainly one of the more welcoming. From check-in to warm-up right down to ab finishers, I felt none of that "exclusive" standoffishness that so many LA gyms present, whether intentionally or not. The membership fit into a full spectrum of age, gender, and body types - from casual ClassPassers like me to actual fitness professionals - and the teachers were total rockstars, Kinsey in particular. Her riotous enthusiasm and genuine hospitality set the tone for that first workout and every workout since. After a year and a half of membership, I'm still proud to call HIIT House home.

about:
HIIT House LA is a 50 minute HIIT (high intensity interval training) program.

Each class is separated into 3 circuits of 3 Exercises (performed for a minute each), that you will complete 3 times. Why repeat the same exercise 3 times?  It often takes a minute to truly master proper form.
We want you safe and working efficiently! So, first round of the circuit is all about getting the form down, second is about about getting stronger and the third time through is about crushing the exercises.
The workouts are presented in two flavors:

BUILD: 

Whether your goal is hypertrophy (gaining muscle mass) or long and lean muscles, this is the class for you!  You will be put through 3 circuits of 3 exercises 3 times!
This means you get 3 touches on each exercise to truly master the lift  and exhaust the muscle group.  This translates to big gains!

SHRED: 

The name says it all.  This total body class is High-intensity interval training (HIIT) at it's best!  You will be put through intervals of high-intensity exercise followed by low intensity exercises.
These workout are designed to burn the fat away!  Come get shredded!

Each class ends with abs and stretching

I know, I know! In a world of 35 minute workouts, why is our workout sooooo long?  I'm glad you asked!  We include a warm-up, HIIT workout, abs, annnnnnd stretching.
text: FUN!!! I am so happy to have found this place. I showed up early mornings for the amazing one week trial and was so sold on it. They made every rainy tired morning a fun energetic playful party and there's also some community meet ups and fun things around the gym classes. Recommend!

text: This place is AMAZING. After being winded by my first class, I was in love. It's a smooth mix of cardio, and weight training, and the stations are so organized. Special out to A - A RON for his super dope playlist! He unexpectedly played my anthem "Little Booties Matter" the other day, and it that song gave me LIFE for the remainder of my workout. Special shout to all the Lil' booties out there! If no one else cares, just know I DO, because I am YOU.
