text: Can't believe I never reviewed this place. Hiit house was my first gym in LA, I stayed with them for about 8 months and I loved it so much. I only quit because I moved in another part of the town. What I really like about this gym is that I was able to take any classes without being worried about who will teach cause all the coaches are very nice and officient. The circuits are always well balance and the coaches will always well explain all the exercices. They will correct you individually and you will be sore after each session. Since everything is made to give you the best experience, the people who train over there are always in the best condition to contribute to the good ambiance. You can also make friends since mixers are organize once on a while. And last but not least, prices are very reasonable compare to what you can pay in LA. Highly recommended.

You just have to show up and you'll definitely leave feeling accomplished. My fave days are the full body days.

text: I loved this place. I came in to try their free week and had some great workouts. Aaron and Steve are great coaches/trainers. You don't have to be super fit to work out here, all you need to do is be willing to do some work and get some sweat.

about:
Our Run & Shred classes was designed to create the ultimate hybrid workout of cardio and strength. Each day of the week will focus on a run of either endurance, speedwork or hills paired with a specific body part including lower body, arms & abs and core!

Our Eagle Rock location continues to provide the same amenities we offer in Pasadena. We thought of everything to make it easy on you!
Secured lockers for your belongings with phone/device charging stations built in
Complimentary towel service
Subway tiled showers that include natural products
Men's and women's restrooms stocked with razors, shaving cream, deodorant, hair dryers for your convenience
Complimentary filtered water
Bottle waters available for purchase
Grip socks available for purchase
Grab your sneakers and grip socks and let's RUN, SHRED... let's MORPH! Let's rock Eagle Rock!
text: I LOVE this studio because it combines my two favorite workouts in one place - running and Pilates.  Each time I attend class, I'm sweating my eyeballs out so much that I can barely see!  Also, I have yet to make it through the entire class without feeling nauseous from over exertion...yes it's that intense but it's only as intense as you push yourself to make it.  The trainers are also amazing.  They make it a point to learn your name and encourage you throughout the session.  They'll also gently nudge you to push just a little more and correct your form when you need it.  I'd recommend taking the Essentials class in Pasadena first to familiarize yourself with the terminologies used in Lagree as the class is pretty fast paced.  Try this class out and you'll be addicted.  I sure am!!!

text: My Husband and I love Metamorphasis! It's not just another work out studio. You have a sense of community, support and family when you walk in the door. I have never been more challenged in my life. My husband was a collegiate water polo player and hasn't had a work out challenge him like College until now! Go check this place out if you have not already.

text: Super stoked that they opened the second studio! And this one consists 2 of my favorite workouts, tread and megaformer! All equipments are brand new. They have the latest Woodway treadmills, which are super easy on the knees. Bright and clean studio, same amazing instructors and helpful front desk people. Very easy to find parking on the side streets if you don't want to pay for meters. Definitely give it try and you will be hooked!

text: Oh my god, this class KICKED MY BUTT (literally). I did the shred and run class, and managed to run faster and further than I ever would've pushed myself, even AFTER a good 25 minutes of intense, slow muscle work on the machine. I found abdominal muscles that I didn't even know I had. This was my first time on a megaformer, but I still found the movements easy to follow and replicate, and Jennifer took extra time with correcting form for beginners. My booty is still feeling the burn of those deep hip extensions. A few weeks of this would have you swimsuit ready in no time. It's a bit expensive once you're done with the new member package, so unless you're willing to fork out some serious $$ towards your fitness goals, I'd use this as an occasional full-body workout that will help push you past your regular workout plateaus.

text: I've been staying in shape for 8 years with barre workouts and yoga. Recently I've wanted to take it to the next level. Now I used to hate treadmills. I mean they're tread-mills. But this place gets me over that because you have a coach with a plan. The Pilates machine work is (initially) quite difficult--after five sessions I'm still not exactly graceful--but the coaches are patient and explain clearly the objective of each move.

text: Took my first class here this morning, and I had an awesome experience. It was super easy to sign up for online. I took the 6am class, so parking right in front of the studio was available. Leah greeted me upon arrival and was so welcoming. She walked me through the amenities and the machines (the treadmill and the megaformer) as well as how the class is run. The treadmill work was challenging and pushed me, which I need. And while I've never been on a megaformer before, I followed instructions from Leah and observed the rest of the class and made my way through. Both Leah and another classmate were extremely supportive and helpful. Such a tough workout and really excited for my next one. Glad to find something to help me push myself!

text: Such an amazing class!  Ashley was my teacher and was so helpful with introducing me to this new method of pilates.  She had great energy and played great music!  The studio was clean and the staff was overly helpful and friendly!  Go take Ashley's class, you won't be disappointed!
